These would be made available to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Bakir will purchase three milk cows and feed for them. He will place them in the old cattle-shed located in his yard. He will produce cheese and sell the cheese on the local open market. The income for the family will significantly increase and the living conditions for the family will improve. Bakir will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows and feed for them

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is 24 years old, single, and lives in Kobuleti District, West Georgia with his brother, sister-in-law, parents, and a nephew. Badri is the only income provider in the family. He is a mini-bus driver, but he is not the owner of the transport. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

Badri is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase his own mini-bus. With his mini-bus, he will transport the passengers between Kobuleti and a neighboring district. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program will provide business start-up and re-startup loans with soft conditions to the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and who are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan, the income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Along with the above-mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus.

loans.name: Leodila

texts.es:
Leodila, de 48 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, convive hace 28 años al lado de Riter de 43 años de edad y fruto de su amor tienen dos hijos de 17 y 21 años, hace 4 años pudo obtener su casa propia comprándolo con el dinero que pudieron ahorrar con su pareja, ahí pasa sus días en compañía de toda su familia dando siempre lo mejor de sí para continuar hacia delante y conseguir sus metas. El negocio de Leodila consiste la venta de madera, para desarrollar esta función viaja continuamente hacia las zonas ribereñas en donde encuentra a la venta la cantidad de madera que necesita, todo lo adquirido es transportado a la ciudad en uno de los botes que usa para transporte via fluvial. Lleva realizando esta actividad cerca de 1 año y trabaja con la ayuda de su yerno. Además, tiene 3 botes adicionales en los cuales transporta pasajeros o mercaderías hasta los centros poblados asentados en la ribera de los ríos, su función principal es realizar el contrato con los comerciantes que transportarán sus productos hacia los lugares ya establecidos en su recorrido, en el caso del traslado de personas solo tiene que convocar a las personas colocando un aviso informativo con el lugar a donde se trasladará y una vez que su bote esté con la cantidad de pasajeros recomendado, parte hacia su destino brindando toda la seguridad que se requiere. Durante el tiempo que lleva en esta actividad aprendió a conocer las necesidades materiales de los pobladores de las zonas que visita y eso le sirvió para determinar la cantidad y la frecuencia con la que debe realizar sus viajes con la mercadería necesaria, sus ganancias son muy buenas y eso le da mucha tranquilidad y seguridad para continuar haciéndole frente a las adversidades que se puedan presentar en el camino. Este es el crédito 3 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000), comprará mayor cantidad de madera para continuar trabajando en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Leodila, 48, is a good, kind, very hardworking woman.  She’s lived with Riter, 43, for 28 years and they are the parents of two children who are 17 and 21 years old.  She was able to buy her own house four years ago thanks to the money she and her spouse were able to save.  She spends her days there in the company of her entire family always giving her best to continue moving forward and reach her goals.

Leodila’s business consists in selling lumber and to do so she constantly travels to areas along the river where the lumber she needs is sold.  Everything she acquires is transported to the city in one of the boats used for river transport; they she looks for customers.  She’s been doing this for nearly a year and works with help from her son-in-law.  She also has three additional boats she uses to transport passengers or merchandise to population centers along river banks.  Her main function is to enter into contract with merchants that transport goods to these places that are along her route.  With respect to people, all she has to do is call them together by means of an informative ad placed in the place she’s headed to and once her boat has the recommended number of passengers she heads out providing all the required safety precautions.

During the time she’s been doing this, she’s learned to know the material needs of inhabitants in the zones she visits and this has helped her determine the amount and frequency of visits she must make carrying the necessary goods.  Her profits are very good and this gives her much peace of mind and security to continue facing the adversities that might arise along the way.

This will be MFP loan #3 and she’s very happy to know that she has financial support because she’ll feel surer about advancing in her work.  She also commits once again to make her payments punctually like she’s done previously.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very responsible and mutually supportive.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy larger amounts of lumber to continue working in the city.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 20 years of age, who is married and has a single child. Ahmad is the only provider of the family.

Ahmad owns a small shop and sells women outfits. He established his business in 2009. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a 2,100 USD youth loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a person who defines herself as charming, friendly, open, and very nice to everyone. She is married and has three children, between the ages of 8 and 14 years.

Joyce decided to launch a business that would enable her to help her husband financially. This is why she started selling ballast and blocks; she has seen it go well, and she has been helping with her household's finances.

The loan that Joyce has applied to Yehu for, will be used to buy ballast and blocks. Currently her business is going very well, as Joyce does not lose heart, and works enthusiastically each day to improve the quality of life for her entire family.

Joyce's dream is to see her business grow and expand, and with this income continuing to help her household, and providing a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy ballast and blocks, which she will resell.

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer is 41 years old. He lives in a small village of Lagodekhi District with his wife. Vladimer requested a loan for a family business start-up from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. The income from this is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Vladimer requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved, in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to country rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Vladimer will purchase a car. After purchasing a car he plans to serve local people as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car, for work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Está casada y tiene 4 hijos. Vive junto a la última hija en su casa propia luchando por salir adelante y mejorar su nivel de vida. Doris se dedica a la venta de pescados, por lo que posee un puesto de ventas que ha instalado en el frontis de su vivienda, afortunadamente tiene buenas ventas y considerables ganancias ya que su lugar de trabajo esta muy bien ubicado en una esquina donde hay mucha afluencia de gente. Pero considera este trabajo muy sacrificado pues tiene que conseguir sus frescos productos en el puerto pesquero para ello tiene que madrugar. Entre las especies que más compra está, el boquichico, palometa, sardinas o bagres. Ella sabe que todo su esfuerzo vale la pena y es recompensado al ver quesu  hija tiene todo lo necesario para estar cómoda. Lleva en este negocio más de 11 años, trabaja sola y afirma que las ganas por hacer las cosas bien y generar ingresos económicos para su familia son su principal motivo para ir en busca del progreso.
Le gusta la libertad que le brinda este negocio ya que puede divertirse por las tardes jugando y practicando algún deporte además de estar al lado de su familia, espera seguir trabajando para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio por lo cual desea complementarlo con la venta de plátanos.
Este es el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos, está comprometida al pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. 
El monto solicitado (S/. 800) lo invertirá en la compra de pescado para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Doris, 46, is a hard-working, dedicated woman who is determined to get ahead.  She is married, has four children, and lives with the youngest in their own house, striving to get ahead to lead a better lifestyle.  Doris sells fish for a living, out of a stall she has in front of her house.  Fortunately, sales are high and she earns a good profit, thanks to the fact that her strategic location is on a visible corner.  But her work requires much sacrifice to get the quality, fresh products she sells to her customers.  She gets up early in the morning to go to the fishing port to get the most popular items, such as boquichico, sea urchin, sardines or catfish.  She knows the effort is worth it, since her daughter has everything she needs to live comfortably.  

Doris has been in business for 11 years now, and works alone.  Her motivation for wanting to get ahead is her desire to do a good job and earn an income for her family.

She enjoys the freedom her work gives her, since she can spend the afternoons practicing some sport, while spending time with her family.  She hopes to continue expanding her business and begin selling bananas.  This is her second loan through the MFP institution.  She is grateful to all the people who make this loan possible, allowing her to continue toward her goal.  She is committed to paying off the loan on time.

The amount requested will be used to buy fish and bananas so she can continue working.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 57 years old. She lives with her husband and son in Sevan city. She graduated from Dilijan Medical College. After education, Gayane is working as a medical nurse in Sevan hospitals. Gayane's husband is a driver and her son is working as a military specialist. They are solving the whole family's needs together. 

Gayane’s son studies at Gavar State University in the field of history. Gayane asks for Kiva lenders to loan 180,000 Armenian drams to pay her for son’s education.

loans.use: To pay her for son’s education

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen is a 33-year-old woman. She lives with her family in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a taxi driver, while all of her children are students.  She has been running a beauty salon for the past five years, which makes her an experienced and skilled person with this.

Presently, she is interested in purchasing a variety of cosmetic products for the salon, like lipsticks, makeup kits and facial creams. In order to do that, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to grow her business in the future, with the profit amount. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase many cosmetic products for sale at the salon, like face creams and makeup kits.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy, a 39-year-old woman, rents a house where she lives with her two children, both of whom are studying. 

Dorothy has a small shop where she sells a variety of items such as rice, beans, flour, sugar, oil, and detergent. She has been doing this for some years and, thanks to God and her determination, she has managed to keep it going for all this time. Dorothy is very hard-working and, above all, very enterprising and responsible. Her dream is for her business to flourish and to increase her income, so she can improve her and her family's quality of life. 

With this in mind, she has applied for a loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust to invest in her small store by buying merchandise such as flour, sugar, rice, beans, detergent, coffee, snacks, and more. As long as her shop always stocks what her customers are looking for, Dorothy will be able to achieve her dream of improving her and her family's living conditions. She trusts in God that this will happen.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store such as flour, sugar, rice, beans, detergent, coffee, snacks, and more.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Agé de 42 ans, Issa a une épouse et est père de 4 enfants. Il est domicilié  avec sa famille dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Issa exerce les activités commerciales depuis plus de 10 ans. Sa boutique est située au centre commerciale de Koutiala. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus, car sa demande est de plus en plus grande et il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité,  Issa a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs.  Il est à son  4ème prêt   individuel.  Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition d’un grand stock d’articles en plastique constitué de carafes, de seaux, de baignoires, de pots et d’assiettes. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et auprès  des grossistes de Koutiala. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Issa compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA, qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts de Soro, satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
ssa is 42 years old. He is married and has four children. He lives with his wife and children in the town of Koutiala (Sikasso Region).
Issa has been working in retail for over 10 years. His store is located in the Koutiala commercial center. This business brings him an important income as the demand keeps growing, and he has many customers every day. In order to meet customer expectations and expand his business, Issa has turned to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution for help in attaining his goals. He is on his fourth individual loan. This loan will be used to build a large stock of plastic items such as pitchers, pails, bathtubs, pots and dishes. He stocks up in Bamako and from wholesalers in Koutiala. Expanding his business, Issa plans to earn a monthly revenue of 90,000 West Africa Francs, which will be used to pay off  the interest and provide for the needs for his family, with the rest reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy plastic items.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 34 years old and lives in the Kitale area of Kenya with her husband and four children, all of whom attend school. For the last 11 years, she has earned a living as a farmer, producing maize, milk and eggs which she sells at a local market in her area, and earns additional income by running a mill for grinding grain. She is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry to raise on her farm so that she can sell the products they produce. In the future, she hopes to expand the size of her farm. Her main challenges are disease, the high costs of seeds and inadequate capital. She believes that Juhudi Kilimo is the best microfinance institution she has access to.

loans.use: to buy more livestock for a poultry farm.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 27 years old. She lives in a small village of Bolnisi District with her mother, brother, and a sister-in-law. Manana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. In particular, they have 30 hens. They sell eggs locally, in an open market. The income is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Manana requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved, in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Manana will purchase piglets. She plans to raise them and then resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: Dilshad's Group

texts.en:
Dilshad is a 55-year-old woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, she has been running a general store in her house. She works very hard to meet her family needs. She needs additional capital for the growth of her business. 

For that, Dilshad, as a member of four-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a variety of products like flour, biscuits, ice cream, candies, sugar, and rice. This will help her to more professionally satisfy her clients  as well as to increase her savings for the better future of her children. Dilshad is very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is 25 years old from Gaza. He is married. He has been cleaning houses and carpets for houses and institutions since 2007. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a new cleaning machine and a tile polishing machine.
He hopes that this loan will help him increase the scope of his work, increase his customers and thus improve his income .

loans.use: to buy a new cleaning machine and a tile polishing machine.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 38 years old, married, and has four children, whose ages range from 8 to 18 years. She operates a retail business within a busy market area. She is a good mother who desires to educate her children.

She's been in her business for 10 years, and she sells seasonings, cooking oil, onions and tomato paste. She began her business because her mother was a businesswoman and trained Patricia in business. She stared her business with her savings and some help from her family member.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more food commodities to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to change her family's standard of living. In the future, she would like to become a supplier. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food commodities to resell at her market stall, including seasonings, onions and tomato paste.

loans.name: Bakhruz

texts.en: Bakhruz is 32 years old and lives in the Marneuli District with his parents, brother, wife and two children. He and his brother are artisans and his father works at a poultry farm. They all earn a monthly salary, but Bakhruz is requesting this loan from Kiva and Credo to start a new business on his own. Kiva and Credo run a loan program for start-ups that provides credit on favorable terms to poor people who live in rural areas and do not have access to traditional sources of credit. Bakhruz will use the loan to buy a mini-bus so that he can sell green grocery products. He will buy these groceries from local farmers at wholesale prices and sell them at retail prices in nearby towns. The new business will increase his family's monthly income and allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a mini-bus to use to sell groceries.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Fatmata from Kandeh town Bo. She is married and has nine children between the ages of 7 and 24 years. Five of her children are currently going to school. 

Fatmata sells wax cotton, lace, palm oil, and gari. She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business throughout the week, even at night. When customers come to buy, she will sell. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation cost and competition in the market.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy general stock items like palm oil and gari . The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her level of living and educate her children. In the future, she plans to have a permanent residence of her own. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy general stock items like palm oil and gari.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en: Ivane is 29 years old. He lives in the suburbs of Tbilisi with his family: wife, parents-in-law and sister-in-law.  Ivane’s wife is a waitress and his father-in-law serves the locals as a taxi driver. Ivane’s economic activity is his newly-started business. In particular he is a shoe-maker and sews shoes. Ivane requested credit to expand his business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative from Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credit on soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Ivane will purchase leather materials and sew shoes. He will sell his production for a good price and get a profit.  The new business initiative will increase the monthly income for the family. Their living conditions will improve and in the future they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase leather and sew shoes

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 40 years old.  He lives in Tbilisi, with his wife and father-in-law. George requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is his wife’s salary, working as a baker. She makes a total of 600 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

George requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit George will purchase a car. After purchasing a car, he will serve people as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase  a car and work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding plates, rods, sets of spanners, and vehicle spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is 22 years old and lives in Gaza.   He owns a shop selling mobile phones and mobile accessories, which he has been doing for one year.

Hamza is requesting a youth loan from Ryada, which he will use to buy mobile accessories and build an attic. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase mobile accessories and build an attic.

loans.name: Manuel Elias

texts.es:
Manuel vive en el cantón manta tiene 25 años. El tomo la decisión  de buscar trabajo  para terminar sus estudios y ayudar a su familia, pero como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. El  decide reunir dinero que tenia para así dar apertura su negocio de ventas de ropa. En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció hasta llegar a tener una excelente clientela.
Manuel con el préstamo  comprara  ropa, joyas   varios etc.  Su meta es poder tener un local de ropa y joyas y ayudar a su familia  y mejorar su forma de vivir
texts.en:
Manuel lives in Manta canton and is 25. He decided to look for work so that he could finish his education and help his family. Since no one gave him the chance to work in a company, he used his money to open his clothing business. The business has grown slowly and now has a good client base. 

Manuel will use the loan to buy clothing, jewelry, and other merchandise. His goals are to have a clothing and jewelry store, help his family, and improve its well being.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry.

loans.name: Shareef

texts.en:
Shareef is a very ambitious man. He works very hard to expand his business, a store that sells handbags and accessories. Now he has opened a new branch.
Shareef is a 30-year-old young, married man and a father to two sons and one daughter. Shareef would like to improve his business by buying more products for his store. 
He requested a 1,500 USD Youth loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to increase his sales and improve the family's income. 
Shareef is pictured above in his store.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's handbags and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 37 years old and lives in Margibi County, which is the highest-producing rubber plantation in Liberia.  She is married and has six children between the ages of 6 months and 20 years.  They all live at home and five attend  school.  For the past 19 years she has been involved in business, and presently she is selling charcoal and red oil in the local market.  Sometimes slow buying is the problem she faces. She started this current business by selling charcoal by the bag for her mother.  She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal and red oil for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and red oil for her business.

loans.name: Bothaina

texts.en: Bothaina is 26 years old and lives in Gaza with her husband and three children. Since 2009, she has earned a living by running a beauty salon. She is applying for a youth loan from Ryada in order to buy more cosmetics and decorate her salon. She hopes that this loan will increase her income and allow her to buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and decorate her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
José, habita en la Ciudad de Granada, padre de gemelos, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Es un cliente Kiva el  cual está muy agradecida con su primer préstamo porque pudo invertirlo en la compra de leña, arroz, azúcar, pan, café, granos básicos, porque gracias al financiamiento obtenido ha ido creciendo  como comerciantes  y ha podido incrementar sus ventas.
Es por esta razón que él está solicitando su segundo financiamiento para seguir invirtiendo en lo mismo como arroz, azúcar, cosméticos y granos básicos. Uno de sus propósitos es poder cancelar el crédito para volver a solicitar otro para seguir creciendo como empresario.
texts.en: José, who lives in the city of Granada, is father of twins and a salesman in his grocery store business. He's a client of Kiva and feels very grateful for his first loan. He invested it in firewood, rice, sugar, bread, coffee and basic grains, and was able to grow his business and increase sales thanks to this financing. This is why he is now requesting a second loan to continue investing in the same type of products, such as rice, sugar, cosmetics and basic grains. One of his goals is to repay the loan so as to be able to request a new one and continue growing as a businessman.

loans.use: to continue investing in the same type of products, such as rice, sugar, cosmetics and basic grains.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 27 years old. She lives in Zestaponi District with her mother, husband and 2 infant daughters. Lali requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is a monthly pension of Lali’s mother and the small income earned by Lali, working as nurse in the local kindergarten. She earns 250 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Lali requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Lali will sell clothing. She plans to buy clothing and then resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin to trade in clothing

loans.name: Dusko

texts.en: Dusko is married and the father of two children who are three and five years old. His wife takes care of their home, which is located in a minority community in Kosovo. For the last three years, he has run his own business repairing motorcycles. At the beginning he worked in front of his house but he now has his shop, is famous for his work and has lots of customers. He needs a loan to buy tools and spare parts for motorcycles, and to renovate his business. The loan will help him increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. His goal is to provide his children with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for a motorcycle business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 33 years old and is from Gaza.  He is married and has two children.  He has owned a travel and tourism office since 2010.  He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy furniture, and some decorations.  He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income to save for a new house.

loans.use: to buy furniture, and some decorations

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en: Fikrat is 48 years old. He is married and has three children. This is a third loan for Fikrat. He was very thankful to Kiva and every lender. Now he needs a 2300 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy calves to improve his agriculture business. He needs in your help very much.  Fikrat has been an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli town. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 21 years old and is from Gaza.  He owns a shop for selling poultry.  He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more chicken and a refrigerator for frozen chicken.  He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo is a 31-year-old farmer from Gugarq village. He keeps eight cows and 15 chickens. He also cultivates potatos. Despite his young age, Kamo has a good deal of experience in agricultural businesses. This is the only source of income for him and his family.

Kamo lives with his parents and sister who are also involved in agriculture. He has applied for this loan to expand his agricultural business. With part of the loan he will purchase barley seeds and will start the cultivation of the barley. With the other part of the loan Kamo will purchase forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for Kamo to be able to increase his income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for barley seeds and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en: Hazem is 38 years old and is from Gaza.  He owns a small automobile to deliver goods and services.  He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a new small automobile and do maintenance to the old one. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and enlarge his scope of work.

loans.use: to buy a new small automobile and do maintenace to the old one

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is from Horom village, of the Shirak region. She lives with her two sons: Mnatsakan (who is 25 years old) and Artyom (who is 21 years old).

Together with her sons, Susanna is involved in agriculture. She keeps two cows and cultivates wheat and potatoes. She is a very hard-working woman and does her best to gather a good harvest and sustain her family. 

Agriculture is the only source of income for this family. Susanna gets milk and makes cheese and other milk products. Her sons help her to sell those products in the local markets. 

Susanna has applied for this loan to purchase potato and barley seeds and forage for feeding the livestock. Cultivation of barley and potato will give her an opportunity to gather more harvest and will increase her monthly income. The loan is very important for this family to expand their agricultural activity and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for potato and barley seeds and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en: Arusyak is 36 years old and lives in the town of Sisian with her husband, mother-in law and children. She earns a living by raising a cow and 15 chickens, and also cultivates wheat. Together with her mother-in-law, she uses her cow's milk to make cheese, which her husband sells in a local market. Because farming helps her family have a stable income, Arusyak has applied for this loan to expand her herd by buying two calves and forage for them to eat. This will help her produce more cheese and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy two calves and forage for them to eat.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu is 50 years old and lives Margibi County, which has the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and has six children between the ages of 15 and 30. Only three live at home and attend school. For the past eight years, she has been selling rice-bread (banana mix baked with rice dust) in her community. Problems she faces is the high price of bananas and that crushing the rice into dust is really difficult. She started this business with money from her oldest daughter and learned this way of baking from her oldest sister. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, bananas, and rice for her business. She promises the supporters of BRAC that she will pay back her loan on time. She plans to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase oil, bananas, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Haidi Betzabeth

texts.es:
Haidi  vive en las orquídeas  tiene 18 años. Es casado  tiene un  hijo. Ella tomo la decisión  de buscar trabajo para salir adelante con su familia y terminar de estudiar, pero como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella decide reunir dinero que tenia para así dar apertura su negocio de venta de cosméticos. 
En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció hasta llegar a tener una excelente clientela. Haidi con el préstamo  comprara cosméticos, perfumes, ropa para tener mas variedad y asi tener mas ventas.   Su meta es culminar los arreglos de su vivienda y comprar un auto.
texts.en:
Haidi lives in Las Orquídeas. She is 18, married, and has a son. She decided to look for work to help her family get ahead. No one gave her the chance to work for a company, so she gathered her money to open her cosmetics business. The business has slowly grown and has an excellent client base.

Haidi will use the loan to buy a wider range of cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing to increase sales. Her goals are to finish renovating her house and to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, and perfumes.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 48 years old and lives in Margibi County, which has the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is single and has four children between the ages of 25 and 32; they all live on their own. For the past five years she has been selling dry goods (rice, vita, candles, toothpaste, flour, sugar, oil, and pepper) in her community. She started this business by selling charcoal by the bag for her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, vita, candles, toothpaste, flour, sugar, oil, and pepper for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, vita, candles, toothpaste, flour, sugar, oil, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en: Barbra is married with seven children; only three of her children go to school. She also takes care of her cousin. She operates a retail shop at the market and has been in this business for two years selling to all categories of people on retail. She generates additional income through tailoring and mending torn clothes. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 400000 from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and 50Kg of rice. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and transportation. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start importing used clothes. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and 50kg of rice

loans.name: Noelina

texts.en: Noelina is married with five children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She is a dry cleaner and has been doing this business for two years working seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 300000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more basins, liquid soap, a flat iron and to pay for rent. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring to rent a bigger room where she can work and also building her own house in the plot she acquired. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more basins, liquid soap, and a flat iron.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama is 29 years old and lives in Margibi County, which has the highest-producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is single and has four children between the ages of 4 months and 10 years. They all live at home and only three are in school. For the past five years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She faces problems during the rainy season. She spends nine hours a day at her business. She received money from her husband to start this business. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. She wants to build her house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is single and takes care of additional family members (sister and old mother). She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 4,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through selling fish. She moves door to door selling used clothes, as well as fish.  She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her movements. She aspires to get a permanent business premise and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying for utilities and medications.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals for his trade

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
Martha, tiene 64 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su hijo, nuera y 3 nietos.
Doña Martha, tiene 3 años de tener su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica, como ser arroz, azúcar, sal, café, pan, salsina, pastas, papel higiénico, refrescos, carnes, condimentos, otros productos enlatados. Ella quiere tener más surtido su pulpería para incrementar las ventas y los ingresos. Esta solicitando un préstamo de 13,000 lempiras, siendo este el sexto ciclo con ODEF, con el cual va comprar más productos para surtir la pulpería como refrescos, carnes y granos básicos. Su meta es ampliar el negocio y con las ganancias va mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Martha, 64, is a single mother; she has a son.  She lives in a village belonging to the municipality of Tela, Atlántida with her son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren.

Martha has had her own grocery store for three years where she sells basic staples like rice, sugar, salt, coffee, bread, Salsina [brand of spice mix], pasta, toilet paper, soft-drinks, meats, condiments and canned goods.  She wants to increase stock in her grocery store in order to increase sales and income.  She’s asking for a 13,000 Lempira loan which will be her sixth cycle with ODEF that she’ll use to buy more products like soft-drinks, meats and basic grains to stock her store with.  Her goal is to expand the business and use profits to do home improvements.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandised for her store.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en: Satta is 33 years old and lives in Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and has five children between the ages of one month old and 12 years old. They all live at home and only four attend school. She was unable to attend school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman. For the past three years she has been selling used clothes in the local market, and she faces no problems currently. She sells every day and spends 12 hours at her business. She started this business with a little income she received from her husband. For her mother, she is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Eunice Nyambura

texts.en:
Eunice is a member of Focus Women's Group based in the Gatukuyu area of Thika in Central Kenya. She is married with five children; three are still in school and two work as casual laborers.

Eunice is a dairy farmer with three cows, which produce about 10 liters of milk per day. She sells the milk for about $0.50 per liter, and with this income she is able to feed her family and pay her children's school fees.

She wants to construct a biogas plant on her farm to offset her fuel expenses. Every day she spends about $1 on kerosene for lighting and $0.50 on charcoal and firewood for cooking. With a biogas source, she will spare this money and use it to expand her farming business.

From the biogas she will also produce slurry, which she will use on her land to increase production. With increased production she can improve her family's food security and income.

loans.use: For biogas construction

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a single woman with two children of her own. She also cares for her late sister's child. She lives in the Mangu area of Thika District in Central Kenya. 

She is in the business of selling wood, saw dust, and charcoal. Through the Kwarahuka Women's Group -- which means "women with a wake-up call" -- she wants to take a loan to purchase clean cookstoves to sell, thereby boosting her income.

From the charcoal business she earns at least $2.25 per day, and from cookstove sales she believes she can earn an additional $3.40 per day.

With this added income she will be able to repay the loan and support her family. She hopes to grow her business and one day create employment for others.

loans.use: To purchase clean cookstoves for sale

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a 35-year-old, single mother. She has three children, ages 3, 7, and 15. The older two go to school. 

She rented a small shop in the middle of the trading center and she operates a cosmetics shop. She chose this place near her home to help her reduce transport costs since she has so many other expenses to cater to. 

She started this business after her husband had abandoned her and married another woman. As a single mother, Prossy has to strive to see that her children get all the basic needs met. Her customers trust her cosmetics because they are genuine.

Prossy needs a loan to purchase more stock to boost up her business. As a single parent, Prossy faces the challenge of providing the best basic needs for her children. For the business, lack of enough capital and stiff competition from cheap cosmetics sellers are the major challenges that are hindering her progress.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 33 years old and lives in Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and has four children between the ages of 1 and 14, all live at home and three are in school. She was unable to attend school, but she has been managing her business for ten years now, without any default. Sometimes to get her goods from the valley is difficult, because cars cannot reach the valley -- only motorbikes. She started her business with money from her husband, having learned this way of selling from her mother. Rebecca is requesting a loan to purchase dried bush meat to resell. She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase dried bush meat to resell.

loans.name: Balunkeswar Shg Group

texts.en:
Balunkeswar SHG was formed in 2006 and is composed of ten members in a small village in Odisha. 

Susama is the lady who is standing in the third position on the left side of the photograph. She is wearing an orange, black and red color saree. Susama, aged 29, is an educated member of their group, so she was selected as the leader of Balunkeswar SHG. Susama has two sons and one daughter. She is living with her husband and her three children. Her children are continuing schooling. 

With the loan that she is receiving, Susama plans to boost her agricultural business, and to do so she will purchase chemical fertilizers, rent a field and pay for the cost of labor. In order to strengthen her agricultural business, she plans to improve her strategy and make use of new farming techniques.

Both Susama and her husband have been involved in this activity for five years. They have good knowledge of paddy cultivation and vegetable cultivation.

Susama currently grows rice. She has requested a loan to grow her agriculture activity. Her ambition is to expand the business for which she is receiving financial support, and to diversify her activity by growing vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers, rent a field and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Bofa

texts.en:
Bofa is 20 years old and lives in the area of Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest-producing rubber plantation area of Liberia. Bofa and her boyfriend live together, along with their two children, aged 1 and 4 years. Both children live at home and one attends school. Bofa is a high school graduate.

For the past two years, she has been operating a little shop where she sells charcoal. She started this business with a loan from her mother. She enjoys her business, because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal by the bag for her business, and she plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal by the bag, for her business,

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
Masudi is a married farmer living in the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. He has been involved in subsistence farming, mainly to meet the family's needs. He now plans to invest more into farming, and maybe he will do cash crop farming.

He was invited to join Milango by his friends, and he joined to access capital. Masudi is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenyan shillings to pay for seeds, fertilizer and labor. He believes this is a good venture, which will help to improve his family's food security. The extra income will go toward loan repayment and meeting other family needs.

loans.use: To pay for seeds, fertilizer and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Asata

texts.en:
Asata is 28 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  She lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia.  For the past six years, she has been operating a provision shop where she sells soft drinks, rice, soap, and other items. She earns a large profit although sometimes she has fewer customers. 

Asata is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more soft drinks, rice, soap, biscuits, and other items to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, rice, soap, biscuits, and other items.

loans.name: Blue Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her early 20s, is married, with one small baby. She has been running a charcoal business for three years now.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Salma's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd.  She used the previous loans to buy a TV set, a refrigerator, a mattress, and a bed; covered household expenses; and bought more stock of charcoal. She has successfully paid back all her loans. 

Salma hopes for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, 'Blue Group,' which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Yamileth de 30 años de edad, originaria de Matagalpa, pero actualmente vive en Estelí, soltera,  madre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 4 y 13 años, de oficio comerciante, se dedica  al negocio de pulpería. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio vendiendo chiverías, la  cual poco a poco  fue  incrementando el inventario de su pulpería, y de esta manera ha podido obtener mejores ganancias,  y   hacer crecer su negocio, ella se siente muy satisfecha  porque  obtiene ingresos a diarios, cuenta con clientes fijos en su pulpería, este ha sido su primer negocio. Sus expectativas es ampliar su pulpería en una distribuidora para poder ofrecer de todos los productos más solicitado por sus clientes.
Es por esta razón que ella está solicitando el financiamiento  para comprar  arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, pan, jabón, etc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar  toda la mercadería en general que aún no tiene en existencia de su inventario, con el propósito de obtener mejores ganancias  en su negocio y  hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
30-year old Yamileth was born in Matagalpa but now lives in Estelí. She is a single mother with two children aged 4 and 13 and earns her living running a general store. She started out selling dairy products and then gradually added other items. In this way she was able to earn more money and grow her business.

Yamileth feels happy because she has a daily income and regular customers. This is her first business. Her plan is to expand the store so she can offer all the products most asked for by her customers.

For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, soap etc. She thinks that this loan will help her to buy all the merchandise that at the moment she does not stock. Then her income will be greater and she will be able to expand the store.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, soap etc.

loans.name: Satto

texts.en:
Satto is 24 years old and has five children who attend school.  She lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. For the past five years, she has been running a table, where she sells oil, salt, vita, peppers, and others items. She started this business with help from her mother. 

Satto is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more oil, salt, vita, rice, peppers and others items for her business.  Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase oil, salt, vita, rice, peppers and others items.

loans.name: Eyling Del Carmen

texts.es:
Eyling  de 41 años de edad, originaria de  Estelí, casada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de  7, 17 y 18 años, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio con ayuda de una amiga que le dio ideas para que emprendiera su propio negocio, la cual miro muy bueno y decidió establecer  la  venta de tortillas, negocio que le genera ingresos a diarios, ya que ella cuenta con clientes fijos, este ha sido su primer negocio, también recibe el apoyo de su esposo, sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio para que le genere más ganancias.
Eyling está requiriendo al financiamiento para comprar, maíz y leña. Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar  todos los  productos necesarios para la elaboración de sus tortillas, sus planes futuros es  incrementar sus ventas con el objetivo de poder salir adelante con su familia, una de sus metas es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en:
41-year old Eyling is a native of Estelí. She is married and has three children aged 7, 17, and 18. She sells tortillas, a business she began with help from a friend who gave her ideas for businesses she might start. She felt that a tortilla business was a good idea and would bring in a good income on a daily basis. Eyling now has regular customers.

This is her first business and her husband also helps her. Her hope is to expand the business and thus generate a greater income.

Eyling is seeking a loan to buy corn and firewood. She thinks that the money will help her buy all the products necessary for making tortillas. Her plan for the future is to increase sales so that she can help her family get ahead. One of her goals is to improve the building where she makes the tortillas.

loans.use: buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 37 years old, single and lives in Kakata Town.  It is the capital city of Margibi County and the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She has three children between the ages of 2 and 12 that are in school and live at home.   She stopped her education at 9th grade.

For the past seven years she has been selling charcoal from a table in the market. She focuses on charcoal because the consumption of charcoal in Liberia is very high.  She established the business with a loan from her mother. She enjoys the independence her income gives her. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a shop and a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Lakheswar Self Help Group

texts.en:
Lakheswar Self Help Group was formed with nine members in 2006 in a small village in Odisha. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They chose Pramila as the leader of their group. The lady standing first from the right side of the photograph is Pramila. She is a 35-year-old woman living with her husband and her son, aged 11. 

Since ten years ago, Pramila’s husband has been working as a farmer to manage his small family. It is not sufficient to manage the family. So Pramila is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in the milk business. She has three years experience in this business. She has requested a loan to buy a cow and fodder so that she can support her family’s income.

Pramila says that by selling milk, she can support her family and she can send her son to a good school; through that, she can provide a better education to her son.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fodder for her business.

loans.name: Juana Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Juana se preocupa por la humanidad, ya que por vocación de servirles a los demás  se decidió estudiar auxiliar de enfermería, de la cual tiene 36 años de ejercer tan noble labor, trabaja en un centro de salud de la zona donde habita, es soltera con 4 hijos a su cargo los que le brinda el apoyo necesario como madre,  actualmente está solicitando un pequeño financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda la cual está en mal estado, y lo utilizara en la compra de Cemento, Arena, Zinc, Alfajillas y Mano de Obra, para construir Bajarete, Techo y Piso de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que con mucho esfuerzos ha venido realizando.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana has always been concerned about people. In order to serve others she decided to study to become a nursing assistant and has been engaged in this noble profession for 36 years. She works in a health centre near her home. 

Juana is single but responsible for four children whom she supports like a mother. She is seeking a small loan to improve her home which is in poor condition. She wishes to buy cement, sand, zinc roofing, wood posts, and hire a builder to construct walls, a roof, and flooring. This will improve the condition of her home which she has been working hard to do.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, zinc roofing, wood posts, and hire a builder

loans.name: Adile

texts.en:
Adile, twenty-two years old, is married and a young mother of two children. She and her family live in a village in a southern part of Kosovo in very bad conditions. 

In order to earn a living, her husband works transporting goods for others and earns a very small income. Adile, along with her husband, is now planning to buy a horse as a way of providing and transporting goods, such as wood and other materials, for others. This business is the only main source of income for the family. 

Adile is now requesting a loan in order to purchase this horse, which will help them to increase the family income. Her goal is to improve the living conditions and overall quality of life for her family. She hopes in the future to give her children a better education and wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for transporting goods.

loans.name: Yesenia Maria

texts.es:
Yesenia de 32 años de edad, originaria  Estelí, casada, madre de 2 hijos, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de carnes. Inicio su actividad laboral  a la edad de 26 años, con capital propio, dinero que le dio su marido,  la cual ha podido establecer su negocio de venta de carne,  ella se siente muy satisfecha ya que le genera ganancias a diarias  porque cuenta con clientes fijos, este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es ampliar el área del local en donde tiene  su negocio.
Ella esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar carne de res y cerdo.  Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayuda a incrementar sus ventas de carnes, para obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es poder ofrecer más variedad de carne a  sus clientes, una de sus metas próxima es  cancelar el crédito para luego volver a solicitar otro para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 32 years old and is originally from Estelí.  She’s married and is the mother of two children.  She sells different kinds of meat and started doing this when she was 26, with money that her husband gave her.  She is very satisfied because it generates daily earnings and she has steady customers.  This is her first business and she wants to expand it.

She needs this loan to buy beef and pork.  She expects this loan to help increase her sales and income.  Her future plans are to be able provide a better variety of meat to her customers.  One of her next goals is to pay off this loan and then request another one for her business.

loans.use: to buy beel and pork.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona es una mujer emprendedora junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos ellos se dedican a la actividad de la siembra y cultivo de papa, ella tiene una amplia experiencia en esta actividad que aprendió hace más de 20 años dicha actividad que fue enseñada por sus padres a los cuales ella les agradece por haberle regalado e inculcado el respeto a su prójimo el amor a DIOS y a la familia y lo mas importante en esta vida haberle enseñado a trabajar.

Simona tiene un grado de educación primaria que curso hasta el 4 grado; pero con mucho esfuerzo hizo que sus hijos siguieran estudiando y pudiesen realizare, hoy en día cuenta con el apoyo de sus esposo y sus hijos mismos que agradecen el esfuerzo de sus padres, su producto es comercializado y vendido a través de los intermediarios en el mercado local, en la actualidad parte de la tierra que utiliza Simona para la siembra y cultivo de papa es alquilada y para poder llegar a su área de trabajo caminan una hora aproximadamente.

Simona actualmente solicita ayuda para comprar semilla e insumos agrícolas para la siembra de papas actividad por medio de la cual ha podido salir adelante con su familia, ha podido ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, alimentos, vestimenta, etc.

El sueño de Simona es poder comprar un terreno el cual pueda ser trabajado propiamente y poder realizar sus cultivos para así poder obtener ganancias propias en su totalidad que ayuden al crecimiento de su negocio, a tener un mejor estilo de vida y que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Simona is an enterprising woman. She, her husband, and their four children grow potatoes. She has extensive experience in this work that she learned more than 20 years ago. This livelihood was taught her by her parents, whom she is grateful to for having given her and instilled in her, respect for her neighbor, and love of God and family. Most importantly in this life, they taught her to work. 

Simona has a primary school education and went as far as 4th grade. But with a great deal of effort she has enabled her children to continue studying.  Today she has the help of her husband and of their children, who are grateful for the parents' efforts. 

Their crop is marketed and sold through the middlemen in the local market. Currently, part of the land that Simona uses for growing potatoes is rented, and in order to reach their farmland they walk for approximately an hour.

Simona is currently requesting help in order to buy seeds and agricultural supplies for growing potatoes, work that has enabled her and her family to move forward in life. She has been able to provide her children with education, food and clothing. 

Simona's dream is to be able to buy a piece of land that can be properly farmed, where they can raise their crops, and this way obtain profits that will be completely their own, and help their business grow. This will enable them to have a better standard of living and ensure that their children can continue going to school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and supplies for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en: Jennet is 34 years old and lives in the area of Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She’s married and a high school graduate. With little income from her husband who is a motorcyclist, she is determined to make their lives better by engaging in a small fabric sales business. Jennet has been in this business for five years now and she enjoys the flow of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fabric to sell to enable her to build a shop for her fabric business. Her dream is to become a houseowner in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beehives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Juraqul

texts.ru: Журакул житель Яванского района. Ему 48 лет. Он женат, отец 4-х детей. Один сын работает трудовым мигрантом. Сам Журакул зарабатывает на жизнь услугой такси. Он возит пассажиров на своем личном автомобиле. Журакул занимается этой деятельностью уже 18 лет. Он просит кредит у организации для ремонта своей автомашины. Надеется, что это улучит процесс его работы.
texts.en:
Juraqul is a 48-year-old resident of the Yavan region. He is married and has four children. One of his sons is a migrant worker. 

Juraqul himself has been working as a taxi driver for 18 years. He drives his clients in his own car. He is requesting this loan to repair his car, which he hopes will improve the operation of his business.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beehives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, who appears in the photo, is a 49-year-old, married man and a father to one son and five daughters. He is a school teacher and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Ahmad is a very ambitious man and always thinking of his family's future, to always offer to them better living conditions.

Ahmad also is a university student who wants to complete his Master's degree studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Ahmad and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Tukolere Wamu Farmers Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of men and women who are typical farmers located outside the city on route to the western part of the country. Rovinsa, a divorcee, joined the group because she could not get far on her own and therefore needed external help in the form of a loan. After the divorce, the husband neglected her and the children whom she has to single handedly provide for all their needs. 

Rovinsa makes bricks to supplement her meager income. Her main challenges are unpredictable weather changes and an unstable market. She will use part of the loan to buy a piece of land to enlarge the farming area and the remaining balance to clear tuition arrears for her children.

To be able to fend for seven children and a dependent takes hard work and determination, which Rovinsa has totally embraced and so have all the group members.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Dina Margarita

texts.es: Dina Margarita de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de comida desayunos y almuerzos, frijoles, gallina, carne, verduras, arroz, sopas, bebidas, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en la preparación de comidas, gracias a eso obtiene las mejores ganancias, comercia desde su hogar y  ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio; Dina es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y con muchas metas que desea lograr, quiere ganarse un futuro mas prospero y trabajara duro hasta alcanzar el éxito que tanto desea, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, carnes, verduras, bebidas, etc. Dina Margarita tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Dina Margarita, 40, lives with her children in her own house.  She works selling food like breakfasts, lunches, beans, chicken, meat, vegetables, rice, soups and beverages.  She’s been in business several years and has gained much experience preparing food.  Thanks to this she earns better profits.  She sells from home and has many customers because people prefer her because everything she sells is top quality at affordable prices and service is good.

Dina’s an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and who has many goals she wants to reach.  She wants to earn a more profitable future for herself and to work hard to reach the success she so desires.  

In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of it to make a new investment which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn, meats, vegetables, beverages, etc.  Dina Margarita has good payment references and flawless morals; she’s sure that she will repay the loan while at the same time is confident that she’ll provide her family with a fulfilled life.

loans.use: to buy corn, meats, vegetables and beverages.

loans.name: Osaid

texts.en:
Osaid is a 19-year-old, single man. He lives with his family in Kofor Raaee village near Jenin. His father and mother are employed and both are getting low salaries, which barely cover the family's needs.

Osaid is studying at the university, specializing in Accounting. Osaid wants to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so he is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Osaid and improve the family's living conditions. Osaid is shown in the picture.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi, who appears in the picture, is a 28-year-old, married man and a father to two daughters. Fadi is employed and gets a low salary which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Fadi is a very ambitious man who is looking to improve himself and create better living conditions for his family. 

Fadi is studying at the university, specializing in Business Administration. Fadi wants to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so he is requesting a USD 1,250 loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Fadi and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has five children with four of them currently in school. For the past five years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small shoe business. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more school-going shoes for resale, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and pay half the school fees for her children. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to own a residential house. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more school-going shoes for resale

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en: Ibrahem is a 35-year-old married man. He is a school teacher who earns a low salary that is not enough to cover all of his family's needs. Ibrahem is looking to improve his position at work to increase his income and to live in better conditions. Ibrahem is studying at the university, specializing in Business Administration. Ibrahem wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Ibrahem and improve his family's living conditions. Ibrahem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay his university fees

loans.name: Omri

texts.en:
Omri is a 27-year-old married man with no children yet. He lives in a modest house with his wife and has a small grocery store, where he sells different types of groceries. The store has been profitable and is his only source of income.

Omri and his wife are suffering from a water leak in their house, which has increased in the winter season. Omri wants to fix this matter, so he is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN. He will use the loan to purchase the necessary materials and hire workers to fix the part of the roof that is causing the water leak. This will create for Omri and his wife suitable home conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their house. Omri is photographed inside his house.

loans.use: To fix his leaking roof.

loans.name: Juana Marizol

texts.es:
Juana es una señora bien Optimista en cuanto al desarrollo académico ostenta la especialidad de Licenciada en administración de empresa, contador y actualmente está estudiando licenciatura en maestra de educación primaria, es Casada con 2 hijos a su cargo, a los  que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen, estudian en los colegios del municipio, tanto en secundaria como en primaria.

Una de las necesidades que la señora  Juana  atraviesa hoy en día es de graduarse como licenciada en educación primaria, producto del gran esfuerzo realizado para alcanzar tan deseado sueño, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión de visitar  ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para realizar los estudios de sus sueños,  el que le beneficiara aun mas en su centro laboral, por el nivel académico que presentaría, lo que de paso le vendría mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is a very optimistic lady who is trained as a company administrator, accountant and is currently studying for a master’s degree in primary education.  She’s married and has two children and she wants to provide them with the best conditions so that they can develop and study in the local schools, both in middle and elementary schools. 

One of Juana’s needs is to graduate with her master’s in education; the result of great effort to achieve her dream.  This allowed her to make the decision to visit Ceprodel to request a loan to be able to study.  This will benefit her even more in her work and allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Javi Rakel

texts.es:
Javy es una joven casada y madre de familia luchadora, emprendedora con deseos de superarse y seguir adelante ella ha enfrentado un obstáculo con sus estudios ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos y no le pudieron dar la oportunidad de estudiar, junto a su esposo decidieron buscar mejores oportunidades para salir adelante tomando en cuenta que contaban con un enorme potencial LA JUVENTUD, LA SALUD y enormes deseos de hacer otra actividad más que ser simplemente una ama de casa, su esposo dedicado desde toda su vida a labrar la tierra en donde lo que él hace es para poder llevar lo necesario a la casa, ambos vieron la necesidad de que uno de los dos tenía que ver la forma de generar un poco mas de ingresos, por lo que se le presento a javy la oportunidad de poder sacar un curso de belleza impartido por FUDEIMFA brazo técnico de la cooperativa COMIXMUL. gracias a esta oportunidad aprendió a valerse de una forma distinta, ella se capacito en cortes de cabello de mujer y de hombre, actualmente ella visita casa por casa atendiendo personas de todas las edades solo con 2 tijeras una capa y dos peines.

JAVY actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de herramientas y materiales para trabajar como ser: secadora y plancha para el cabello, una silla, espejos, mesa, capas, peines y cepillos ya que en la comunidad donde ella vive hace mas de 6 meses instalaron la energía eléctrica lo que le facilita su trabajo para realizar sus servicios.

Su sueño es tener un salón de belleza el cual pueda generar ingresos para poder ayudar a su esposo con la canasta básica y otros gastos que a diario se presentan e ir ahorrando para darle a su hijo un mejor futuro para que el tenga mejores oportunidades que ellos y pueda superarse.
texts.en:
Javy is a young married woman and a hard-working parent. She is enterprising, and has the desire to improve herself and get ahead in life. She has faced an obstacle with her education, as her parents are low income and couldn't give her the opportunity to go to school. 

She and her husband decided to look for opportunities to succeed, considering that they had tremendous potential in terms of youth, good health, and her strong desire for an additional livelihood apart from being just a housewife. Her husband has worked the land all his life, where his work enables him to support the household. 

Both saw the need for one of the two to find a way of generating a bit more income, and an opportunity arose for Javy to take a beauty salon course offered by FUDEIMFA, the technical arm of the COMIXMUL cooperative. Thanks to this opportunity, she learned to fend for herself in a different way. She trained in cutting men's and women's hair.
