She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation material to insulate her house against Mongolia's harsh winters. She is a hardworking and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material to insulate her house against Mongolia's harsh winters.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 27 years old and married with 2 children.

Jenalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell sell bamboo split in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional bamboo to sell.

Jenalyn has borrowed, and repaid, 23 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell bamboo split for 7 years and also earns an income from her general store.

Jenalyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Badamnyambuu

texts.en: Mr Badamnyambuu, who is 50 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working at a furniture-manufacturing plant for five years. His son works in a Korean gas company. He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase an automobile which is propelled by an electric motor. One of the reasons of choosing an electric car is that it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates, volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. The electric car he is purchasing will be used by his son for transportation due to the long distance between his work and their home.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has applied for a loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell, like shampoo, sugar, milk, cream and can goods.

Jocelyn has been in this business for one year and she also earns more income from buying and selling charcoal. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, sugar, milk, cream and can goods.

loans.name: Leliosa

texts.en:
Leliosa is 41 years old and married with 6 children. With 4 children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Leliosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional canned goods, sugar, coffee, spices, and other items to sell. 

Leliosa has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Leliosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, sugar, coffee, spices, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old, married and has five children. From a very young age she helped her mother in the rearing of chicken, until she formed her own family. Thanks to the experience she acquired she was able to start her own poultry business, which she says is doing well. She has had this business for the past seven years and everything she does is to support her children.

The loan Esther is requesting from Yehu is to buy more chicks and chicken feed. She hopes to remain in business and make the income needed to improve her quality of life. Her aim is to save money to enable her children to have an education.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Munkhbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhbayar is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in an apartment. Her husband suffered a back injury in 1997 while working in Korea on contract and since then has been unemployed. Munkhbayar herself works as a senior teller in a bank. One of the family’s other income sources is renting one of the rooms of their home. 

Munkhbayar is requesting a loan of 6,700,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase an electric car so that her husband can start a taxi service for local people. In addition, the electric car produces no harmful exhaust pollution, such as particulates, volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. Thus, it will contribute to efforts to reduce air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car for her husband's taxi service

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is a 44-year-old married woman, and the mother of 3 young children. She is from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has been raising hogs for 4 years. Aside from raising hogs, she is also engaged the business of fish vending. Her husband is a fisherman. Felisa sells the fish that are caught by her husband. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like nylon, hooks and epoxy. Felisa would like to expand her business by investing in other ventures in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nylon, hooks and epoxy.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina works hard to support her child. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Lina has requested for a loan of 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer as the Envirofit stove needs less fuel to cook food.

Lina is aware that by using this cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing the health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items and milk for selling for profit.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en: Pastora is 49 years old. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Pastora is 62 years old and separated. She has 3 children. She operates her own retail business to earn a living. Pastora's income from her business is 4,000 PHP each month. Pastora has been in her business for 11 years. She joined GDMPC in 2011. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In the future, Pastora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, 62, is married with five children.

Elena is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Elena requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for 21 years now. She has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, 53, is married and has 6 children. 3 of them are in school.

Lilia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilia has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business. 

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 25-year-old saloonist in Kilifi, Kenya. She is married and her husband brings in additional income. Together they support four children. She has been in this business for the last two years and she has done well. 

She is requesting this, her second loan, to purchase hair weaves and cosmetics for her salon. She will use the anticipated profit to pay off her loan. Her previous loan was repaid successfully and she hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hair weaves and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Erdenesaihan

texts.en:
Mr Erdenesaihan is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife Udval, aged 36, is temporarily unemployed and stays at home and takes care of their family. His daughter Hualn, aged 7, goes to the local primary school. His other daughter, Enhjin, who is 4, goes to the local kindergarten. Mr Erdenesaihan has been working part-time as an interior designer in a construction company. 

He is now starting his own business, a butcher shop, at a rental counter of the local market. His sister-in-law has been running a butcher shop in the same market for over 10 years and she will help him to start his business. He is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory from herders at a low price and sell to customers at a higher price. He is hardworking, a fast learner, and communicates well.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory from herders at a low price and resell to customers at a higher price.

loans.name: Delgertsog

texts.en: Delgertsog, 48, is a widow who lives with her son in a small house in Selenge Province, Mongolia. Her son Mongonshagai, 14, goes to a local secondary school. The borrower worked at road construction company for years but left her job because of her health condition. She has started her own business selling secondhand clothing sales at a rental counter in a local market last year. She is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory for her business. She is a hardworking, strong and responsible woman who says "I only want my son to grow up to be highly educated and able to live on his own."

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Jeikhun

texts.en: Jeikhun is 23 years old, single, and lives in Dmanisi District with his mother and grandmother. Jeikhun is the only income provider in the family. He runs a small dairy farm with a calf and three milk cows. Jeikhun milks the cows and sells the milk locally. He is requesting a loan which he will use to purchase a mini-bus. With his mini-bus, he will transport passengers between Amamlo and Baku. He will also transport fruits and vegetables from his village and sell them in Baku for a good price. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program will provide business start-up and re-startup loans with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and who are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan, the income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Along with the above-mentioned, Jeikhun's family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Gene has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Gene aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for resale

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad lives with her family in the town of Baclayon, Bohol, Philippines. She earns a living by selling home-cooked foods to the people in her neighborhood, which she has been doing for several years.

Natividad is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy additional ingredients such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil, and seasonings. With the loan, she will be able to cook and sell more food thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Natividad hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to  purchase ingredients such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil, and seasonings

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 49 years old. She lives in Tkibuli District with her husband and two children. Nana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is Nana's salary, working at the local municipality.

Nana requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Nana will sell used clothing. She plans to buy used clothing and then resell it among her villagers at a higher price.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to sell used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo to produce more milk for clients.

loans.name: Kennis Avel

texts.es: Kennis, tiene 23 años de edad, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos. El trabajo varios años en la empresa privada y con sus ahorros estableció su propio negocio de pulpería para obtener los ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar. En la pulpería vende granos básicos, refrescos, pastas, lácteos, verduras, churros, manteca, azúcar, galletas, dulce, productos enlatados, pastillas, etc. este negocio lleva dos años de experiencia y ya tiene buena clientela. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 11,000 lempiras para la compra de más productos como verduras, frutas, granos básicos, azúcar, y otros abarrotes para surtir el negocio y aumentar las ventas y la clientela. Su meta es ampliar el negocio para aumentar los ingresos.
texts.en:
Kennis, age 23, lives with his life partner and their two children in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  He worked for a number of years in a private company.  He used his savings to establish his own business, a grocery store, in order to get income to support his family.

In the grocery store he sells basic grains, soft drinks, pastas, dairy products, vegetables, churros, shortening, sugar, cookies, candies, canned goods, and over the counter medications, etc.  He has two years of experience in this business, and he has good clientele.

He is requesting a loan for 11,000 lempiras to buy more products like vegetables, fruits, basic grains, sugar, and other groceries in order to stock his business and to increase his sales and his customers.  His goal is to expand the business in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, basic grains, sugar, and other groceries in order to stock his business.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru:
Улугбек   жизнерадостный мужчина  в возрасте 36 лет .  Улугбек проживает в посёлке. Улугбек  женат, имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка и   занимаются домашним хозяйством. Улугбек с 2004 года занимается купля  продажей мелко рогатого скота.  Он держит скот у себя в доме. В их семье основным доходом считается откармливание скота   и он старается развивать этот бизнес. 
На полученный кредит Улугбек планирует купить мелко рогатый скот и увеличить поголовье скота.  Он мечтает чтобы его дети учились в хороших учебных заведениях, поэтому старается делать все что в его силах. Улугбек благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Ulugbek is a cheerful 36-year-old man. He lives in a rural area, is married, and has three children. His wife takes care of the household. Since 2004, Ulugbek has been engaged in buying and selling goats and sheep, which he keeps at home. The family derives its main source of income from raising livestock, and Ulugbek aims to develop his business. He plans to use this loan to purchase sheep and goats, thereby expanding the size of his herd. Ulugbek dreams of his children studying at the best schools and universities, and tries to do everything he can to make this happen. He thanks Kiva for the financial help.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Husen

texts.ru:
Хусен мужчина в возрасте 38 лет.  Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Жена портниха и дома занимается шитьем национальной женской  одежды.  Сам Хусен занимается животноводством. Он откармливает скот. Основной доход семьи от животноводства и они очень стараются развивать этот бизнес. Хусен в юности по семейным обстоятельствам  не смог учиться но он мечтает чтобы его дети учились и в будущем работали по профессии, поэтому со свей женой делают все чтобы осуществить свою мечту.
 На полученный кредит Хусен хочет приобрести несколько голов скота и увеличить поголовье. Он планирует откормить их до весны и продать за выгодную цену. Он очень надеется на финансовую поддержку от организации Кива и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Husen is a 38-year-old man. He is married and has two children. His wife is a seamstress and sews traditional women's clothing at home. Husen is engaged in animal farming and raises livestock. This business represents the family's main source of income, and they try hard to develop it. As a young man, Husen was unable to receive good education due to family circumstances. However, he dreams of his children becoming qualified professionals, and he and his wife do everything they can to make this dream come true.

Husen would like to use this loan to purchase cattle and thereby expand the size of his herd. He plans to fatten the animals until spring and then sell them at a profit. Husen hopes for financial support from Kiva and thanks the organization in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 27-year-old single man who has worked as a barber since 2008. He is well known in his region and has a good reputation, which has helped him in making a lot of trusting friendships. This has also helped in improving his business. 

Mohamad is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy tools and make necessary decoration to his shop. He is a hard worker with a very good reputation, well known in  the region.

Mohamad wants his shop to be developed based upon his customers' need. He hopes to expand his business to open a skincare department that he has always dreamed of achieving, which is highly requested by most of his customers.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools, and make necessary decoration of his shop

loans.name: Kilbart

texts.en:
Kilbart is 38 years old and married with four children. Kilbart runs a livestock trading business, which has been in operation for three years, and his monthly average income from the business is KES. 15,000. 


He has borrowed loan of KES. 25,000 which he intends to use to purchase goats for resale.

He plans to use the additional income to re-invest into the business and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Enhsaihan

texts.en:
Mr.Enhsaihan is 44 years old, and lives with his wife and four children in the Niseh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Monhtsetseg, works at home tailoring traditional costumes. His daughter Nomin-Erdene, age 21, and son Tordalai, age 20, are university students; daughter Uranbileg, age 10, and son Byambadavaa, age 9, go to local schools. 

The borrower has been helping his wife run her business of traditional costume production and sales. He sells the costumes in the local market. 

He is now requesting 6'500'000MNT to pay his children's university tuition and other school related expenses. He and his wife both are hardworking and honest people.

loans.use: to pay his children's university tuition and other school related expenses.

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is 44 years old. He is single, and lives with his parents in theTkibuli district. Kakha is currently unemployed. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly retired pension of Kakha’s parents. 

Kakha used to be a shoemaker and sewed shoes, but his job was stopped because of financial problems.  

Kakha has requested credit to restart his business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credit on soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Kakha will purchase sole and leather materials and sew shoes. He will sell his production for a good price and get a profit. The new business initiative will increase the monthly income for the family. Their living conditions will improve, and in the future, they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in the event of need.

loans.use: to purchase sole and leather materials for sewing shoes.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 28 years old and lives in Voi with her husband, Ramadhan, a surveyor. They have not been blessed with a child yet. She considers herself a simple, respectful and hardworking person.

Joy has sold clothes for the past two years, and she has established a good customer base. The loan she is currently seeking is for the purchase of clothing that she can sell, and increase her income.

Her dream is to grow her business, have her own home, and save for her anticipated children so that they can have a better education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is married and works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation and internet cafe businesses. Pablita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and piglets.

Pablita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Zhoan's Group

texts.en:
Zhoan and her group are a laughing little bunch who had a hard time standing still for a picture. 

Zhoan is a 23-year-old young Iraqi woman. She is single, and lives with her family. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Zhoan is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Zhoan has four years of experience with her small, home-based sewing and tailoring business, making custom-order dresses and other small fabric household items for her customers. She would like to improve her working conditions, and renew her work area.  A small portion of the group's loan  will allow her to pay for the renovation and improvements.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to improve her work conditions and renew her work area.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn, 30, is married with one kid. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Genalyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Genalyn requested a 11,000PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Genalyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg, 46, is a single mother. She lives with her 2 sons in ger in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. Her son Mongon-Orgil, 23, works at the fire department as firefighter and her younger son Mongonbagana, 21, is a sophomore at university. The borrower has been working as tailor in a local private company since 1997. She is now planning to start her own tailoring business at home. Therefore, she is now requesting 1.500,000 MNT to purchase an initial inventory for her newly started tailoring business. She is a hardworking, honest and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase an initial inventory for her newly started tailoring business.

loans.name: Rakaye Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est responsable du groupe RAKAYE. Sur la photo celle qui ne fait plus partie du groupe est à la droite de la représentante et tient dans ses deux mains des pagnes blancs. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18 ans et le moins âgés à 02 ans. 03 vont  à l’école et elle a 06 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes et prêt à porter depuis 15ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les  hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter  13pièces de pagnes et 03douzaines de prêt à porter.	
Elle veut  épargner  ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne améliorer son activité et aider son mari pour les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatimata is the leader of the Rakaye group. She is the married mother of five children aged 2 to 18, three of whom attend school. She supports six people.

Mrs. Fatimata has been selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and ready-to-wear apparel for 15 years. She buys her stock at the market of sector 10. Her customers are men and women.

She wants to buy 13 pagnes and three dozen ready-to-wear outfits.

She will use her profits to increase her savings. She wants to bolster her activity and help her husband with the household expenses. 

The lady who is no longer a group member is standing on the right of Mrs. Fatimata and holding white pagnes in both hands.

loans.use: to buy 13 pagnes and 3 dozen ready-to-wear outfits.

loans.name: Rema Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Rema II est composé de quatre femmes et un homme .Le jour de l’octroi du crédit, Joséphine et Jeanine deux  membres du groupe de sexe féminin,  étaient malades. Sur la photo, elles ont été  représentées par leurs maris respectivement Aloys et Pascal.
Jacqueline est la représentante du groupe Rema II   et habite à Ngozi. Elle  a   32 ans et est mariée à Enoch, un commerçant de boutique. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, âgés de  1 mois  à 12 ans, dont 3  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (chaussures) depuis  15ans. 

Elle est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chaussures   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait acheter une voiture et voir ses enfants  continuer les études  jusqu'à l’université.
texts.en:
The group Rema II consists of four women and one man. Two female members, Joséphine and Jeanine were sick the day the loan was granted. For that reason, they are represented in the photo by their respective husbands Aloys and Pascal. 

Jacqueline is the representative of the group Rema II. She lives in Ngozi. She is 32 and married to a shopkeeper named Enoch. They have five children aged one month to 12 years old, three of whom go to school. 

Jacqueline has been selling shoes for 15 years. This is her 10th loan cycle with Turame, and she will use her credit to strengthen her working capital. She plans to stock up on shoes for resale, which will help to bolster her revenue. 

In the coming years, she would like to buy a car and help her children pursue a university-level education.

loans.use: to strengthen her working capital and stock up on shoes for resale, thereby bolstering her revenue.

loans.name: Pati

texts.en:
Pati is 50 years old. She lives in Kutaisi District, East Georgia. Pati requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Pati works at local beauty salon as a cosmetician and gets a monthly income. 

Pati requested a loan from Credo to start a business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Pati will open her own beauty salon at her house. She will purchase all the instruments and furniture. As she has been working for 15 years as a cosmetician, she has many customers. This will increase her income to serve clients at her home. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a 49-year-old widowed mother of four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

She has been operating a general retail store for the past two years. She earns 15,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Luzminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She expected such services to help improve her business and living situation. Now she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more items to resell, such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store, such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Jeondry

texts.en:
Jeondry is 33 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

For the past three years, Jeondry has been operating a motorcycle transport business, earning 14,000 PHP a month. 

Jeondry is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase spare parts. 

He joined GDMPC in 2012. In the future, Jeondry hopes to improve his general living conditions and provide education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: 3.11.223.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thủy is 25 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 3.11.223.TT Vạn Hà  solidarity group, which consists of six members. Thủy supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thủy has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Blas

texts.en:
Blas is a 44-year-old carpenter from Albur, Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the carpentry business for more than ten years. 

Blas is requesting a loan to buy materials such as saws, nails, hammers, a measuring tape, and other items. He will use his loan to improve his business and augment his income. In the future, Blas would like to expand his business and explore other business ventures.

loans.use: to buy saws, nails, hammers, and a measuring tape

loans.name: Chro's Group

texts.en:
Chro is a 44-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of three children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Chro is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Chro has 23 years experience with small, home-based sewing and tailoring, and she gained significant experience during these years about her customers' needs. Until now, she has used her old sewing machine to create dresses and other small fabric household items and felt limited with the choices and creative works she was able to offer to her customers. She would now like to replace her old machine with a newer model and would also like to buy an over machine (which enables more sophisticated work). These machines will help her offer more choices and better service. She also plans to buy a cabinet to keep her materials in. To be able to make these purchases, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor and thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to replace her old machine with a newer model and to buy an over machine.

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Otgonbaatar is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (a traditional yurt) in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife, Ariunsaihan, runs a tailoring service business at a rental counter of the local market. His son, Zagzusem, age 7, goes to local primary school and his  daughter, Jargalmaa, age 3, goes to local kindergarten. 

Otgonbaatar has been working as an assistant at a construction site for years, and he produces and repairs golden and silver jewelry at home. He is now planning to make it his business and he is renting a place at the local market. He is requesting 660,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for his new  business. He is a hardworking, diligent and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for his new business.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a single gentleman, aged 24 years. Samson runs a small-scale farming business in Ewalel village, where he keeps chickens as well as growing crops. He has been in this business for the last three years.

Samson has borrowed a second loan of 6,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). With this loan, he intends to use the whole amount to purchase farm inputs in preparation for the next planting season. From this business, he gets an average income of 3,000 KES a month. 

With the anticipated profits, he intends to expand his business by starting a dairy farming business to diversify his sources of income. He will also pay school fees for his siblings who are still young.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs in preparation for the next planting season.

loans.name: Abdullatef

texts.en:
Abdullatef is a 25-year-old single young man who lives with his family in a small agricultural village near Tulkarem. His family earns an income from working in agriculture, but it is barely enough to cover their needs. For the past four years, Abdullatef has operated an entertainment and social gathering place in his village. He provides his customers with hot drinks, like coffee and tea, in addition to providing recreational games such as a pool table. 

Abdullatef is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to purchase a new television to make his store more attractive for customers. This improvement will increase his customer base, which will increase his income and help to create a bright future. Abdullatef is pictured in his entertainment store.

loans.use: to purchase a television

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 53 years old and is a food kiosk owner in Junju Kilifi, Kenya. She is a married lady who is the sole provider for the family. She has been in this business for the last two years and has done great. 

She is requesting for her first loan to purchase dry food stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and beans for her food kiosk. 

She will use the anticipated profits to service her loan, and she hopes to have a big hotel in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dry food stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and beans for her food kiosk.

loans.name: 02.04.07 -Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Ngòi is 66 years old. She is married and has seven children with one dependent; the other six children are grown up.

Ngòi is the group leader of the 02.04.07 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Ngòi operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Ngòi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more equipment to do fishing business.

This is Ngòi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Ngòi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to do fishing business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a 67-year-old widow with four children. She is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. For the past five years, Melinda has owned and operated a nipa-weaving (palm weaving) business where she makes roofing materials. She earns 10,000 PHP each month and joined GDMPC in 2010. 

Melinda is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 26 years old and he supports a family of four. For the last four years, he has been a small-scale mixed farmer who keeps poultry as well as grows a variety of vegetables and cereal crops. David earns 7,200 KES each month. 

David is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase farm inputs for his upcoming planting season. He also will buy a few chicks for breeding. This is his first loan. David anticipates using the profit from his loan to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and chicks

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer, of Calamba, Misamis Occidental, supports her family through nipa (hut weaving business). She is 20 years old, married with one child, and tries her best to earn on her own. 

For 3 years she has managed this business and earns about 4,000 PHP per month. For the time being, she needs to buy raw materials such as straw, bamboo sticks, etc. 

She joined in 2012 and thanks GDMPC microfinance for the loan of 7,000 PHP they provided to her. 

Jennifer desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for her business such as straw, bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 27 years old. He is an electrician who operates an electronic accessories shop in Mariakani. He is a single man who has been in this business for the last four years and has done great. 

He is requesting his first loan to purchase electronic accessories for his workshop. He will use the anticipated profits to invest back into his business, and he hopes to have a successful business and family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase electronic accessories for his workshop.

loans.name: Flacir

texts.en:
Flacir lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old and unmarried. 

Flacir owns and operates a service-based business providing shoe repair services to local community members. Flacir has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Flacir joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Flacir is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional materials for the shoe repair shop. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for his shoe repair shop.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 50 years old. He lives in Mtskheta District with his two sons and a daughter-in-law. Merab requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Merab and his son work as artisans and get a monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence-poor category. 

Merab requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low incomes. 

With the received credit, Merab will purchase a car. After purchasing a car, he plans to serve local people as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Justina Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Justina tiene 50 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de queso, negocio ubicado en el mercado.

Antes de tener su negocio era vendedora de queso de un comerciante que distribuía queso al por mayor adquiriendo así experiencia en este producto alimenticio.

Motivada a desarrollar su propio negocio personal alquila un tramo en donde inicia con esfuerzos propios su plan de negocios de vender queso al por mayor y al detalle.

Ella ha mejorado como microempresaria, sin embargo necesita de un préstamo para incrementar el volumen de sus ventas con mayor disponibilidad de productos en el mercado.

Su estado civil es viuda, tiene dos hijos que le colaboran en la atención al cliente en su negocio.
texts.en: Justina, 50, sells cheese, a business located in the market.  Before having her business she worked as an itinerant cheese saleswoman for a merchant who was a cheese wholesaler; this is how she got experience with this food item.  Motivated to start her own business, she rents a space where she started her own venture selling cheese at wholesale and retail.  She’s improved as a micro-businesswoman but nevertheless needs a loan to increase sales volume with more product on-hand in the market.  She’s a widow and has two children who help her with customer service in her business.

loans.use: to buy quintals of cheese.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 56 years old. Francisco is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Francisco owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Francisco joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hafsa

texts.en:
Hafsa is a 51-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Hafsa is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Hafsa has five years of experience with her small, home-based sewing and tailoring business.Sitting on the floor, she bends over her machine to make the dresses and other small fabric household items her customers order from her. Using a newer model of sewing machine, she has been able to provide her customers with nice, quality work. 

She would like to improve her work conditions and concentrate a bit on renewing her work area, making it a nicer, better place to spend her hours. To be able to pay for the work, she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 1,800 USD.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her work conditions and renew her work area.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 44 years old, married, and has four children. Her spouse runs a farming business that helps in producing some additional income. 

Nancy runs a food stall in Eldama Ravine town. She has been in business for five years, and her monthly income from the business is KES 20,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 for a period of six months. She intends to use it to purchase more food for stock. She plans to use the additional income to expand the business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale.

loans.name: 02.04.06 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 38 years old. She is married and has two children. Thảo lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hoa has a service business, shipping sand. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase a boat to ship sand.  

This is Hoa's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: To purchase a boat to ship sand.

loans.name: Rey Ann

texts.en:
Rey Ann is 26 years old and single. She is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. For the past three years, Rey Ann has owned and operated a nipa-weaving (palm weaving) business. She earns 4,000 PHP each month and joined GDMPC in 2012. 

Rey Ann is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan to purchase the raw materials she needs to weave nipa. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase the raw materials she needs to weave nipa

loans.name: Bendiara Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAMSETOU représente le groupe BENDIARA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans et le moins âgé 15ans. 04 vont à l’école et a 07 Personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des cartes de recharges, gère un secrétariat public (saisie, photocopie) depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne avec les revendeurs et au grand marché. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes. 

Mme veut s’acheter des fournitures de bureau (06 rames de papier, 08 lots de chemises et 05 botes de Bic).

Elle épargne ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne améliorer son activité, employer plus de personnel et aider son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hamsetou is the leader of the BENDIARA group. She is married with four children aged 15 to 24 who all go to school. She is supporting seven people. 

Mrs. Hamsetou has been selling mobile phone recharge cards and running a secretarial service business (data entry, photocopy) for the past 12 years. She buys her supplies from resellers at the big market. Her customers are men and women. 

Mrs. Hamsetou wishes to stock up on office supplies (six reams of paper, eight cartons of folders, and five boxes of Bic pens). 

She adds her profits to her savings. She plans to bolster her activity and hire more staff, and to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy office supplies including six reams of paper, eight cartons of folders, and five boxes of Bic pens.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 35 years old and single.  He lives in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motor transport service, which he has been doing for over five years.  Edwin earns approximately 10,500 PHP a month. 

Edwin is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which he will use to repair an existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. Edwin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 32 years old and married with two children. She lives in Kisauni, Mombasa, Kenya. For the last five years, Juliet has worked sewing school uniforms to sell. She earns a good income and is also supported by her husband. 

Juliet is requesting a loan to purchase material to make school uniforms. This is her first loan and she will use her anticipated profit to construct rental houses. In the future, Juliet hopes to have a successful life.

loans.use: to purchase material to make school uniforms

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 31-year-old married man and a father of one son. He is a school teacher who earns a low salary which is not enough to cover his family's needs. Bilal lives in a small agricultural village near Jenin, which is famous for its olive farms. He and his family also work in agriculture cultivating olive trees. They are able to generate a good income each year by selling their crop to customers.

Bilal is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from Faten to purchase olive seedlings. He wants to increase the number of olive trees on his farm to increase his harvest and improve his family's income. Bilal is photographed in his olive farm.

loans.use: to purchase olive seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is 43 years old. She is a caring, joyful, responsible, supportive, and determined mother of six children. For the past six years, Mwanamkuu has operated a stand where she sells fruits and vegetables. Her business has been a great help for providing an income for her school and household expenses. 

Mwanamkuu is requesting a loan from Yehu to purchase oranges, cabbages, kales, tomatoes, onions, bananas, and other produce to sell. She is an enterprising woman and she dreams of having her own mini-market to increase her income and improve her quality of life. It is because of this that, little by little, Mwanamkuu is increasing her products and her sales.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, cabbages, kales, tomatoes, onions, bananas, and other produce

loans.name: Zoe

texts.en: Zoe is 37 years old and lives in the Jacob Town area, one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County; she’s single with two children between 16 and 18. They live at home with her and are in school. She has been involved with the sales of used clothes for past 4 years. She started this business with the help of her boyfriend who give her some money. This business helps her to send her children to school and take care of her home. She has requested this loan to purchase more used clothes to resell. She hopes to build her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her family's livestock and dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for building supplies, a door and window to renovate a room in her house as her work and business area, and to purchase a professional sewing machine and additional cloth and thread.

loans.name: Mukuche

texts.en:
Mukuche is married and has four children, three of whom attend school  He lives in the coastal region of Kenya. For the past four years, he has been operating a motorcycle taxi business in the rural area of Tiribe. 

Mukuche is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy spare parts and do general servicing of his motorcycle so as to provide quality services to his clients. He says that he faces a challenge during the rainy season since he operates on a muddy road.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and do general servicing of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam, who appears in the photo, is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother to two sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs.

For the past ten years, Heyam has had a photography shop. She has a good reputation among her customers and her shop is located in a well known area where there is good commercial traffic. This makes her project a profitable one that provides a much-needed second income to the family. However, from time to time it needs more support to cover some costs.

Heyam is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to cover the costs of purchasing a new specialized photography camera.

This will allow Heyam to expand the scope of her work, improve her business, and increase the family's income.

loans.use: to buy a specialized photography camera.

loans.name: Arche De Noe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mutima, présidente et doyenne du groupe d’affaire « Arche de Noé», est entrepreneur, âgée de  plus de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, tous étudient, parmi les quels, il y a des universitaires et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Elle est vendeuse de friperie et sociétaire d’un atelier moderne de coupe couture. Son mari est un professeur de l’université. Elle étale ses marchandise au long de la route, devant son domicile. Il y a 22 ans révolus,elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 13 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 2 ballons de friperies. En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison dans la parcelle qu’elle avait acheté des bénéfices cumulés de son business. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en: This client, by the name of Mutima, is the leader and chair of the « Noah’s Ark » lending group. She is an entrepreneur, over 50 years of age, married and the mother of six children, all of whom study. Some of them are   university students, and  several have their own households. She sells used clothing and is a member of a modern sewing shop. Her husband  teaches  at the university. She sells her merchandise by the road in front of her house. She has been in this business for 22 years. She just finished 13 loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan will allow her to buy two bales of used clothing. Her goal is to ensure her children’s education and to buy a house on the land plot she had purchased with the earnings from her business. This client thanks Hekima for its support of women lacking financial means and access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy two bales of clothing.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is taking out a new loan to expand on her existing business. Since she received her previous loan, her business has been growing; thanks to her efforts, she has been able to provide good education to her children.

Mariamu plans to use this loan to buy more stock of coconuts for sale. Her goal is to see her business flourish.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Moafq

texts.en:
Moafq is 24 years old. He is a joyful man and full of life. He is a single man. He is very loving and wants to provide his family (parents) with the best quality of life, so that they have a future with no financial problems. 

Moafq was a soldier getting a low salary. He has been in the grocery store business for one year, and during this time he has honed and improved his customer service. He likes his job because it allows him to stay physically active and, at the same time, generate financial income to cover home expenses. 

Moafq applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery items for his business. He wants to keep working and to continue advancing his business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for his business.

loans.name: Patricia  B.

texts.en: Patricia is 31 years old and lives in Jacob Town in Montserrado County. Jacob Town is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a pastor. They have two children, both of whom attend school. For three years now, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. Her business helps her earn more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to provide a higher education for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business

loans.name: Marvin Jose

texts.es:
Marvin de 29 años de edad,  es originario de la Comarca las Minitas, de las afuera de Teustepe, soltero, padre de 1 hijo, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la agricultura. Inicio desde muy joven en el ámbito del comercio, con la ayuda de su cuñada quien le cuidaba a su hija, mientras él se iba a realizar su actividad diaria como es  sembrar  maíz, frijol trigo, fue así que pudo salir adelante con su siembra y con su hija, cuando él no está sembrando, se dedica a cuidar una finca en donde vive, la cual le genera ingresos extras, sus productos lo comercializa en Managua en donde le pagan a un buen precio.

Marvin está solicitando el financiamiento para  pagar mano de obra en su siembra y  comprar una bestia mular. La cual le ayudara a transportar su siembra a otros lugares, ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudara a acudir su siembra y aumentar sus cosechas de maíz y frijoles, sus metas próximas es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Marvin, age 29, is from the Las Minitas region on the outskirts of Teustepe.  He is single and has one child.  He is a farmer by trade.  He started in this field when he was very young.  He did this with the help of his sister-in-law, who takes care of his daughter while he does his daily work activities.  He grows corn, beans, and wheat.  That is how he was able to get ahead with his crops and with his daughter.  When he is not planting, he takes care of a farm where he lives.  This generates extra income for him.  He sells his products in Managua, where they pay him a good price.

Marvin is requesting the loan in order to pay for labor for sowing and to buy a mule.  This will help him transport his crops to other places.  He thinks that this loan will help him to see to his sowing and to increase his corn and bean crops.  His next goal is to improve the infrastructure of his house.

loans.use: to pay for labor for sowing and to buy a mule.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Emma. She is married, and has 4 children aged 10, 13, 16 and 19 years, who are all going to school. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she got her from the war. 

In 2009, Emma established a business selling onions, maggie, mayonnaise, salt, butter, pop corn, baking powder, ketchup, flour etc. She began her business because she stopped going to school at Form I because her parents were poor. She later got a Teachers' Certificate (TC) and taught for 2 years but because of poor conditions of service she left teaching and started a business.

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 2,550,000 Leones (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Emma has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy:

- moist Maggie (a soap product)
- sugar 
- eggs 
- vegetable oil 
- flour 
- shrimp Maggie

In the future, Emma plans to acquire a shop, provide a quality education for her children and become an international business woman. This loan will help to improve her business. The frequent increase in price of items is her main problem. She is a hardworking business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy Maggie (a soap product), vegetable oil,flour and shrimps Maggie

loans.name: M.ramzan

texts.en:
Mr. Ramzan is 54. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He is the father of 5 children. All of them are students. He owns a motorcycle spare parts shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for his family.

Mr. Ramzan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase more spare parts for his shop. This will help him to increase his net income and savings. He is hopeful that the loan will be productive one for his business and family as well.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies, including bricks and cement, for a ceiling-making business

loans.name: Wonder

texts.en: Wonder is 47 years old and lives in Jacob Town, which is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. It is close to the biggest market in Liberia. She is married and has five children between the ages of 20 and 25 who are attending school and live at home. Her husband is a pastor. For the past five years she has been selling biscuits, candy, rice, pepper, coal and oil in the community market. She makes larger profits some times, but most of the time business is slow. She is applying for a loan to purchase more of the items she sells in her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, candy, rice, pepper, coal and oil to sell in the community market.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. It was taken in his barber shop.
Hiba is an 18-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in a small village near Tulkarem.
For the past seven years, Hiba's husband has had a barber shop, which has been a profitable project and his only source of income. Now he wants to make some innovations in the barber shop decorations.
Hiba's husband doesn’t have  enough money to cover all the costs, so Hiba decided to help him by applying for a $3,000 Youth Loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of redecoration, including installing new mirrors and shelves, and painting.
This will allow Hiba's husband to expand his work and improve his business, and to increase the family's income.

loans.use: to help redecorate her husband’s barber shop.

loans.name: Piru

texts.en:
Piru is 32 years-old and married,with four children. He is from the town of Tiribe, located in the coastal zone of the country. He is known for being responsible, hardworking, of good habits, and with a desire to personally succeed.

Piru has been selling petrol and diesel for the past three years. He started this because he needed a way to generate an income and he took advantage of the demand for the commodity in his locality. 

The business is located in a small store in his home where he sells in half and one litre plastic bottles. He will use the money from this loan to buy gallons of petrol and diesel to sell. Piru is grateful to the Kiva lenders who help people of limited resources in poor countries such as Kenya.

loans.use: to buy gallons of petrol and diesel to sell.

loans.name: Kambi

texts.en:
Kambi is a 21-year-old single gentleman who lives with his parents in the rural area of Tiribe. He has been running his own kiosk for four months. He used to work in farming. Since he is still in his initial stages, he has few products.

Kambi is asking for a loan to buy beans, rice, flour and instant goods.  He is optimistic that his business will grow so that it can become a bigger retail shop in future.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, flour and instant goods

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie lives in the town of Kakata, the capital of Margibi County, which is the largest rubber plantation in Liberia. She is 36 years old, married, and has four children between 1 and 18 years old, who live at home. Only three are in school. Mamie did not attend school. For the past six years, she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She started this business with help from her husband, and she learned the business from her friends. She is applying for a loan to buy more palm oil for her business. She enjoys her business and the profit she receives every day. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Shler

texts.en:
Shler is a 48-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and the mother of three children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Shler is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and to help meet the financial needs of her family.
Shler has two years of experience with her small home-based sewing and tailoring business, creating custom dresses and small household items made of fabric. 
In the past, Shler took out a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq, which she used to replace the old doors and windows of her house. Having successfully repaid the previous loan, Shler is taking out a new loan in the amount of $3,000, which she would like to use to renovate her work space and improve her working conditions. 
Because of the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates the Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages the lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renovate the work space for her home-based sewing and tailoring business and improve her working conditions.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a 42 year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and the mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Sarah is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Sarah has five years experience with the small, home based sewing and tailoring business activity, making custom order dresses and other small fabric household items. She would like to improve her work conditions by renewing her work area that needs some renovation in order to be more pleasant. To be able to pay for the work she took a loan from Kiva partner Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three  to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her work conditions by renewing her work area.

loans.name: Moti

texts.en:
Moti, 30, and his wife live in a house that they rent. He has operated an M-pesa(mobile money transfer) business for four months. Though it has not stabilized, he hopes that it will little by little grow. His customers like him because he provides an excellent service.

Moti is a hard-working and visionary man, always looking for ways to build a better future. He wants to invest in his M-pesa and grow his business, but he needs a loan to add float to his business.

loans.use: to add float to his business of mobile money transfer.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 40 years old, married to Macharia and they have been blessed with three children of the following ages: 21,14 and seven years, respectively. She runs a primary school and she has been in business for 12 years. Right now her monthly income from the business is 20,000 KES.

She is borrowing a loan of 100,000 KES which she intends to use in repairing the classrooms, floors and desks. She plans to used the anticipated profit to improve the service in the school.

This is her third loan and she successfully repaid her previous loan. Her hopes and dreams are to prosper in life and to expand the school.

loans.use: to repair classrooms, floors and desks

loans.name: Gicela Maritza

texts.es:
Gicela, necesita invertir en el negocio en la venta de las tortillas, se comprara maíz y leña, pagara mano de obra y además una plancha para hacer tortillas, esto le ayudara para darle al negocio estabilidad.

Ella comenta que con el préstamo anterior logro fortalecer el negocio, aumento su clientela, atendiendo de una mejor manera, en su familia las condiciones han sido mejor, ya que gracias al crédito kiva se encuentra trabajando para proveer lo necesario.
texts.en:
Gicela needs to invest in her business of selling tortillas.  Corn and firewood will be bought.  She will pay for labor and as well as a griddle for making tortillas.  This will help her by giving her business stability.  

She comments that with the previous loan she succeeded in strengthening her business and grew her clientele by attending them in a better manner.  In her family, the conditions have improved.  So thanks to the Kiva loan, she finds herself working in order to provide what is necessary.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood and to pay for labor and a griddle for making tortillas.

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en: Nigar is a 39-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of four children. Her career options are limited because of cultural restrictions and domestic constraints. That is why she is one of many Iraqi woman who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and help meet the financial needs of her family. She now has three years' experience running a small, home-based sewing and tailoring business. She makes custom dresses to order, along with other small items made out of various fabrics. She uses an old sewing machine, typically while sitting on the floor and bending over the machine. She does not need to replace this machine, but would like to improve her work environment and make some much-needed renovations to her sewing room. To make this possible, she is applying for a $2,400 loan from Relief International Microfinance in Iraq.

loans.use: to improve her work environment and renovate her sewing room.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu, age 38, lives with her common-law husband. She has four children, and she lives in a community in the town of Tiribe.

Mbeyu has been selling coconuts at the market for the last six years. As an additional business she also farms, growing a variety of crops. She was motivated to establish her business in order to help her husband with the family expenses.

She has currently requested a loan for 10,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings). She plans to use the loan to buy more coconuts and materials for their transport. She believes that the loan will help increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts and materials for their transport.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 44 years old and lives in the Kutaisi district with his mother-in-law and daughter. Teimuraz is a partner in the business Limited Company, which imports cars from abroad. He has decided to start a new business with his partner to supplement his income but he lacks experience with new business start-ups and does not qualify under income requirements. 
Teimuraz is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to many credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 
Teimuraz will use his loan to start a car wash. He hired the commercial space and will  purchase essential equipment and a vacuum cleaner. Teimuraz will provide services to his local community members and hopes to increase the monthly income of the family. His new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to start up a car wash

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 43-year-old married man who supports a family of four. His spouse runs a retail shop, which helps by producing some additional income. He runs a carpentry shop in the town of Eldama Ravine. He has been in business for four years, and his monthly income from the business is KES 25,000.
He is taking out his second loan of KES 30,000, which he intends to use to purchase wood and other materials to make furniture in his shop.
He plans to use the additional income to expand his shop and to educate his children. His dream is to expand his business to other towns and to give the best possible education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase wood and other materials required to make furniture in his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Shagul

texts.en:
Shagul is a young 27 year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and has no children yet. 

Shagul is the owner of a beauty salon where she works as a hair dresser and beautician. She has five years experience with her shop and she is proud of her achievements. She is constantly working on improving the services and general experience for her customers. In the past, she took a loan which she used to buy mirrors for the salon, an A/C unit and some small decorations for the shop. Having successfully repaid that loan, she is now taking a new loan to buy a small generator for the shop which will make it easier for her to work during the hours when the city power is off.  She will also add some new decorations to the shop to make it nicer. Shagul is now taking a loan in the amount of 2600 USD from Kiva partner Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.  

Shagul is under 30, and as such qualifies for a youth loan.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a small generator for the beauty shop.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 46 years-old and married with ten children.  His children are aged between 22 and two years old.  He provides transportation services for a fee in Koru and has been in operation for a period of five years earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000. 

He has borrowed a second loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD of KES. 30,000 and he wishes to use this amount to purchase a second hand motorcycle for his business.  

The profits he earns will be used to look after the welfare of his large family and also to reinvest back into the business.  His dream is to purchase a vehicle and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Nyanje

texts.en:
Nyanje, 34, lives with his wife and children and is very committed to his daily job of being a good father and responsible husband. He currently operates a small goat-meat business, which has been going well since he began, and he wants to expand his business and sell more. Therefore, he is requesting a loan through Yehu to buy more goats to sell.

He seeks ways to get ahead in life and believes his work is the way to do this, since it is his only source of income. His goal is to own a butcher shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bee hives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bee hives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Israfil

texts.en: Israfil is applying for his third loan from Kiva. He is very thankful for every loan from Kiva and its lenders. He needs 2300 AZN to buy calves. Israfil is 46 years old now. He lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. He says, "Dear friends! I need your help to improve my business again. I think that you have not forgotten me. Thank you very much! Good luck!"

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bee hives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a threshing maching for corn and labor.

loans.name: Jarsoe

texts.en:
Jarsoe is 47 years old and lives in Montrserrado County which is the highest production point of  fish in the Liberian market. She is married and has six children between the ages of 10 and 30, two live on their own.
For the past few years she has been selling dry goods like rice, vitamins, candles, toothpaste, flour, sugar, oil, and pepper in her community. Jarsoe started this business by selling flour, rice, and sugar  for her mother.  Now she is requesting a loan to purchase rice, vitamins, candles, toothpaste, flour, sugar, oil, and pepper for her business. 
One day, Jarsoe hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase  rice, vitamins, candles, toothpaste, flour, sugar, oil, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John used his previous loan to purchase bricks and sand to sell, which improved his business, and right now his monthly income is 25,000 KES.

He is now borrowing a loan of 100,000 KES, which he intends to use to purchase more bricks, sand and concrete to sell.

He plans to pay back the loan and support his family with the anticipated profit from the business.

loans.use: to purchase bricks and sand to sell

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is 38 years old and lives in Paynesville South, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is single with four children between the ages of 3 and 21.  They are attending school and live at home.

For the past 5 years, she has been selling biscuits, fresh milk, candy, rice, pepper, charcoal and oil in the local market.  She makes more profit some time, but mostly of the time business goes slowly.
