She is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits, fresh milk, candy, rice, pepper, charcoal and oil for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, fresh milk, candy, rice, pepper, charcoal and oil for her business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 36 years old and living happily with his wife and four children who range in age from three to nine years old. He made enough money from his previous businesses to open a cafeteria, where he earns KES. 19,000 a month. He is requesting his fourth loan, for KES. 80,000, from KADET LTD to buy supplies for his business, including maize and wheat flour, cooking fat, tea leaves, sugar, rice and new utensils. He will use the profits he earns to pay school fees and make payments on this loan. His dream is to be prosperous in his business and live happily with his family.

loans.use: to buy maize and wheat flour, cooking fat, tea leaves, sugar, rice and new utensils for his business.

loans.name: Jenebah

texts.en: Jenebah lives in Paynesville, one of the populated areas of Montserrado County. She is 41 years old, married, and has a 2-year-old child. Her child is currently in school and lives at home. Since 2000 she has been selling palm oil, salt, onion, vita, etc. in the local market. She started this business with a small amount of money from her husband. She enjoys interacting with her customers and earning the money that her business generates. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, salt, onion, vita, etc. to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, onion, vita, etc. to enlarge her business

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia, 41, lives with her son in a house that she owns. She is a single and has earned her living by operating a vegetable stand for the last four years. The business has done well and her goal is to own a bigger store. She is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, onions and other items to sell to her customers. This loan will allow her to increase her income and have financial stability in her family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, onions and other items.

loans.name: Santos Rey

texts.es:
Santos de 37 años de edad,  un humilde habitante de la Comunidad la Joya, en las afueras de Teustepe, casado, padre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 9,14 y 16 años, actualmente los tres están estudiando, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio hace 20 años, el cual inicio como ayudante de su jefe quien era negociante, fue allí que adquirió experiencia y total dominio del negocio, luego con dinero que tenía ahorrado decidió emprender su propio negocio como es la siembra de maíz y la compra y venta de ganado, él  cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y el de su esposa,  él se siente satisfecho con sus negocios porque le va muy bien, ha logrado obtener mejores ganancias.

Santos está solicitando el financiamiento  para comprar insumos tales como fertilizantes, abonos, herbicida y alimentos para el ganando. El   estima que este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá comprar todo los insumos necesarios que necesita para la siembra,  con el propósito de acudir su cosecha  e incrementar su siembra, sus planes futuros es cancelar el préstamo para luego volver a solicitar otro para comprar un terreno Y poder ampliar su cosecha.
texts.en:
37-year old Santos lives in the community of La Joya outside Teustepe. He is a simple man, married, and the father of three children aged 9, 14, and 16, all of whom are students. Santos earns his living raising cattle. He started his business twenty years ago, first of all as an assistant to his boss who was a businessman. He gained experience and learned all about business. Then using his savings he decided to start his own business growing maize and buying and selling cattle. Santos has help from his children and from his wife. He is happy with the way things are going and has managed to improve his earnings.

Santos is now seeking a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, herbicide and cattle feed. He believes that the money will help him a great deal because he will be able to buy the supplies he needs to get good crops and increase production. His future plans include paying off this loan so he can get another one to buy more land and grow more crops.

loans.use: buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, herbicide and cattle feed

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 37 years old and lives in the Jacob Town area, one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. She’s single with five children between the ages of 16 to 22.  All of whom live at home and are in school.
For the past 10 years she has been involved in the sale of fabric. Her main challenge is the increase in prices. She started this business with money from her boyfriend. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase more fabric to sell. 
In the future, Theresa would like to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, who appears in the picture, is a 26-year-old single young man. He is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all his needs.
Mohammad wants to improve himself and his contact with his family and his friends. He would like a modern mobile device, so he is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new mobile phone for his own use.
This will help Mohammad to keep in touch with his family, which will better facilitate his life and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a new mobile phone for personal use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bee hives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is 42 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in the town of Tiribe in the province of Coast. She established a business in her house, raising, fattening, and selling chickens, which she has been doing for. three years. She has many regular customers.

Mesaid is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to buy more chicks and chicken feed.  She wants to increase the quantity of chickens she has so that she can increase her sales and income. Her goal is to expand her business and increase her income so that she can give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beehives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beehives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: El Futuro 2 Group

texts.en:
Adriana is one of the members of the group El Futuro (The Future) 2. This group is located in the area surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here with her four children. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to give her children all they need, including a good education. She enjoys working and attending church.

Adriana is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying bags of used clothes that she sells in the flea market. She is Haitian and she lives together with her long-term partner who is also her children's father. Adriana will use her profits to reinvest in her loan and to save for her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy bags of clothes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a driver, They have five children, between the ages of 1 and 22 years. Currently the children are in school and live at home.

For the past ten years, Joyce has been selling charcoal in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers, because her business is in a very good location. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is 35 years old, married, and has four children,  all of whom attend school.  She is the owner of a small business that sells food and drinks at the central market. She prepares a variety of African foods. She started this business with her husband, using some of their savings.

Maimuna has managed little by little to build her business. She is requesting a loan, which she will use buy ingredients such as cooking oil, wheat flour, and beans, so that she can prepare her food items. She plans to stock her business so that she can gain new customers.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as cooking oil, wheat flour, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bee hives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Isabel Hilaria

texts.es:
La Señora Isabel Hilaria es originaria del Municipio de Condega, a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí, reside en su casa propia desde hace unos 15 años junto a su hijo y su esposo el que se desempeña como Pastor Evangélico en una iglesia de este mismo municipio.

La señora Isabel Hilaria se desempeña como maestra en un colegio de primaria en una comunidad de Condega a unos 5 km al oeste del municipio, por lo que ella viaja diariamente a desempeñar su labor desde muy temprano y regresando por las tardes a planear sus clase siguiente. Ella tiene más de 15 años de desempeñar de manera continua este oficio ya que es una de sus principales fuentes de ingreso para el sostén de su familia.

se presento Ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para la compra  de materiales de construcción como son ladrillos y cemento para la construcción de una pared que servirá como división en su casa e ir mejorando mas condiciones de su casa de habitación. Este  mejorara su vida positiva mente y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel Hilaria is from the municipality of Condega, which is located 35 km north of the city of Estelí. She has been living in her own house for fifteen years now, together with her son and husband, who is a pastor in an evangelical church located in this municipality.

Mrs. Isabel Hilaria works as a teacher in a primary school, in one of the communities of Condega, 5 km west of the municipality. She travels every day to work, starting early in the morning and coming back in the afternoon to plan her lectures for the following day. She has been working as a teacher for fifteen years, a job that represents one of the family’s main sources of income.

Mrs. Isabel Hilaria went to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy building materials, such as bricks and cement. She will build a division in her house which will improve its current condition. This will result in the improvement of her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement and bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beehives.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as a focused woman. She operates a restaurant  where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Her business is located within a busy business area and her primary customers are the general public. 

Jane says her biggest business challenge is having inadequate funds for improving her business. 

She will use the 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy ingredients for preparing meals to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be running a hotel.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 40 year old lady, married to John who is a pastor, and she is a mother of two children. She is a poultry farmer and earns an income from the sale of eggs and chicken meat to her customers with a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

She has acquired a loan of KES. 20,000 which she plans to use to purchase chicks and expand the poultry house. 


She plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her school-going children.She hopes to build rental houses on her plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and expand her poultry house

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en:
Emmaculate is a 25-year-old, married woman. She has three children, ages 4 to 10 years. She describes herself as honest and self-motivated. She operates a food stall, where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her stall is located in a relatively busy environment, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more fish for resale. Her business goal is to be the major fish supplier in her town, within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 45-year-old mother married to Peter. She was blessed with seven children who are aged  28, 26, 22, 20, 18, 16 and seven years old.

Ruth sells cereals and she has been doing this business for the last 19 years. She makes a monthly profit of KES. 10,000, and she is taking out her first loan with KADET LTD which she intends to use to increase her stock  to buy more assorted cereals e.g. dry maize, sorghum,peas and beans for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business so it will be stable.

Ruth hopes that she can open another larger enterprise that deals in all retail products and cereals.

loans.use: to increase her stock of dry maize, sorghum,peas and beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more meat for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Jonibek

texts.ru:
Джонибек мужчина в возрасте 33 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка, занимается воспитанием детей а  также продажей молока. Джонибек занимается животноводством, откармливает скот у себя дома. Так как у него нет образования он вынужден только заниматься животноводством. У него дома имеется несколько голов скота и дойная корова которая дает по 10 литров молока каждый день. Жена Джонибека продает молоко соседям и своим знакомым. У них очень хороший доход от этого вида деятельности  и они стараются развивать этот  бизнес. 
На полученный кредит  Джонибек хочет закупить несколько мешков корма для скота. Джонибек очень благодарен  таким организациям как Кива за поддержку и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Jonibek is a 33-year old man. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker: she raises their children and also sells milk. Jonibek is an animal farmer; he raises cattle by his home. Since he does not have an education, he has no choice but to do animal farming. He owns several heads of cattle and one dairy cow producing 10 liters [2.6 gal] of milk every day. Jonibek’s wife sells this milk to neighbors and acquaintances. They receive a good income from this work and try to develop their business.

Jonibek would like to use his loan to buy several bags of cattle feed. Jonibek is very grateful to organizations such as Kiva for their support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bee hives and pay for the colonization of his hives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beehives and pay for colonization.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cultivate his farm and repair the motorcycle used in his transport business.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en: Zurab lives alone in the capital city of Tbilisi. He is 26 years old. The only source for Zurab is a small monthly income working as an artisan. Zurab decided to start his business as the existing income isn’t enough for him and his living conditions are poor. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Zurab will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. The income of Zurab will increase and he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family. Along with the above-mentioned, Zurab will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use it as a taxi

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is 37 years old and lives with her life companion. She owns a book shop, selling different types of stationery, which she has been doing for three years.  Tatu has gained much experience and she earns the best profits. She is very well-known in the area, which has helped her acquire a large clientele because she is a trustworthy person, the stationery she sells is affordable, and her service is excellent.

Tatu is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase books to sell.  She is an enterprising, forward-looking person who is always on the lookout for new opportunities that will lead to success. Tatu has a good credit history and very good recommendations. She is sure that she can repay the loan while at the same time provide her family with the quality of life they deserve.

loans.use: to purchase more books for sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married and has four children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees, feeding the family, and rent.

Jane has a business of selling used clothes. She has been in this business for five years. Jane has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She sells her clothes door-to-door, selling six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

She aspires to become a wholesaler, and to start importing used clothes.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is single and has five children, three of whom attend school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She has a liquor store, which she has been doing for 10 years. She works seven days a week from her home on a retail basis. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. 

Mary is requesting a loan from MCDT SACCO for 1,000,000 Uganda shillings, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of local gin. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She hopes to sell on a wholesale basis only and to build more rental rooms.  She resides in her own house and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees, utility bills, and food for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Outhman

texts.en:
Outhman is a 48-year-old married man and the father of five children. He lives with his beloved family in Ain, where he has worked as a blacksmith for the last 30 years. Outhman is a hard-working man, and he is trusted and recommended by most of his customers. Most of his customers are from his village, and his business is highly sought after in the region.
Outhman is professional about his business. This is his second time to apply for a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy a new car to transport the iron pillars from one place to another, which is necessary to improve his business.
Outhman works hard to improve his business, to insure continuity, and to improve his family's social and financial situations.

loans.use: to buy a new car that is needed for his business as a blacksmith.

loans.name: Kulambiro Prudent Group

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old and lives with eight family members in Kulambiro, a suburb of Kampala. She survives by brick making. The business started way back in 2005 to supplement her fruit selling grocery in order to raise more income to meet the increasing responsibility of supporting orphans that came into her care.

Her biggest challenge is inadequate capital to buy fire wood and pay wages for her worker.

Mary has  decided to get a loan of 350,000. She wants to start building her own home and her dream is to complete the house in the next 2 years .

loans.use: To  begin construction of   a house

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is a 30-year-old resident of Buddo Nagalabi. He tends a poultry farm he started at his home. He started this small project when he failed to get employment after finishing school in 2008. He has to take care of his mother, who retired from working and now stays at home. 
Brian’s major clients are his neighbors, to whom he sells eggs and chickens, and he also takes the surplus to the market. His customers are satisfied with the quality of his poultry products, and this has greatly increased the demand for his products. 
Due to the increase in the demand for his products, Brian wants to buy more poultry and feed in order to satisfy the demand in the market and to make more income. He has hopes of expanding his poultry business and also of keeping other domestic animals for commercial purposes, so that he can be able to succeed in life. Brian is very hard-working, honest and business-oriented.

loans.use: to buy more poultry and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sopiko

texts.en: Sopiko is 27 years old, married, and lives in Martkopi with her husband and two infant children. Several times, Sopiko has applied for loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of her low income and lack of experience in her new business. The local credit providers usually insist on prior experience in the business. One source of income for the family is the small monthly income earned by Sopiko, who is involved in a clothing trading business. She buys used clothing and resells these items to her neighbors. Aside from that, her husband works as a taxi driver. Sopiko requested a loan from Credo to start up her own store to sell clothing herself. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start credits on soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. Sopiko will purchase building materials and build a store. She will buy used clothes for wholesale prices and resell them in her store for a profit. It will be hard work for Sopiko, but, according to estimates, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in clothing to increase her trading stock and sales volume. Sopiko awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up a clothing store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beehives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is forty-three, married, and has five children. Over ten years ago one of her friends advised her to sell mats, which she's been doing ever since. She sells them at the market and from her home.

The loan she is seeking from Yehu is to buy more mats to sell. She wants to keep working and plans to use her profits to continue buying more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more mats to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is married with two children who both go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters).  She has operated a beauty salon business business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 700000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more hair relaxers and boxes of hair oil. She works from home seven days a week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to buy a plot of land so that she can build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more hair relaxers and hair oil.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a single mother of one child, who doesn’t go to school. In addition, she takes care of cousins. She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for two years. She generates additional income through making and weaving mats. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and rice.   Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda.

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler, and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include for her cousins, feeding the family, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and rice

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married, with four children. Three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of market-vending and has been in this business for three years. 

Rose has applied for a loan of UGX 400,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more eggplants, pepper, tomatoes, and onions. 

She generates additional income by selling paraffin (kerosene) and running a restaurant at home. She works six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and defaulters. 

Rose is aspiring to see her business grow enough profits to buy a plot of land, build her own house, and also become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more eggplants, tomatoes, and onions to sell at the market.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a single mother of six children, none attending school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has operated a chicken-raising business for 12 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed and medicine. She rents a shop where she sells to all categories of people on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include   thieves, transportation of feed and chicken diseases. She aspires to become a large poultry farmer and also to build more chicken houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major personal challenges include paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and medicine.

loans.name: Fwzy

texts.en: Fwzy, 29 years old, is a very active and ambitious man. His business in water distribution started when he got a youth loan from Kiva in the amount of 80,000 YER. He deeply thanks Kiva for its support. His business is doing very well and he is planning to expand his business. He wants to buy two water containers and hundreds of water bottles to start serving new customers. He applied for a second youth loan in the amount of 100,000 YER. Fwzy believes that this is going to be a turning point in his business.

loans.use: to pay for two water containers and hundreds of water bottles.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David joined UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) in 2010 for financial assistance to boost his cattle rearing project. He obtained the loan and bought the cows which have enabled him to increase milk production. The milk sales increased his family income and has helped to educate his children.
David is taking this loan to boost his milk production by buying more cows and treating the ones on the farm with veterinary medicine.
He praises the UGAFODE Microfinance Limited - Rukungiri branch for the support which has enabled him to educate his children and maintain his business of cattle rearing

loans.use: To buy more cows and veterinary drugs.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is single and has six children who attend school.  She sells smoked fish, which she has been doing for 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

Safina is requesting a loan from MCDT SAACO for 600,000 Uganda shillings, which she will use to buy more baskets of smoked fish.  Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and scarcity of fish.  She would like to become a wholesaler. Safina hopes to buy a plot of land to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bee hives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 30-year-old mother of four from Israel’s Negev region. She and her husband are determined to create a better life for themselves and their children. Heba used to sell dairy products and loved the possibilities entrepreneurship offered. She decided  to take part in a special business development and training course for microenterprise development. After gaining the skills, she worked with her consultant on a strong and realistic business idea. Heba decided to open a furniture store and did so several months ago. After taking all of the right steps in its opening, she is now ready to expand her stock and expand her store.

Heba needed this loan to purchase expanded stock and bring in popular furniture items for resale.

Heba is on the right track and her business has strong potential. She wants to one day open another branch and expand her business horizons.

loans.use: To purchase an expanded stock of furniture for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes for his store and buy more charcoal for his wife's business.

loans.name: Maclaine

texts.en:
Maclaine is married has two children who attend school. She has a restaurant, which she has been doing two years.  She works seven days a week.  After cooking, she goes door to door selling food. 

Maclaine is requesting a loan from MCDT SACCO for 300,000 Uganda shillings, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, and sweet and Irish potatoes.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She hopes to acquire a permanent business location. Maclaine would like to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and pied water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and utility bills.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, beef, chicken, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is married and has four children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

She has a business, a restaurant. She has been in this business for three years, selling to all categories of people on a retail basis. She works in a shop she rents, and she works seven days out of every week.

Resty has applied for a loan of Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, fish, tomatoes, and sweet and Irish potatoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler, to practice catering outside the restaurant, and to own a fully-stocked restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, fish, tomatoes, and sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Renovacion 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Sujeiri is the coordinator of the Renovación Group 1, 2 & 3, which consists of 15 micro-entrepreneurs from Samana,  a tourist city located in the northeastern part of the country.

Sujeiri is single and has one child.  She sells charcoal and cosmetics through a catalog.  She also makes and sells food. She accumulated these businesses over time since they have allowed her to increase her income and serve different customers. Sujeiri is requesting her tenth loan from Esperanza, which she will use to buy flour, cooking oil, butter, meat, and other goods.

Sujeiri wants to save her income so she can have her own house and give her son a good education and a stable life. Upon finishing her college degree, she plans to be a successful entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her empanada stall.

loans.name: Marie Issa Group

texts.en:
Ramatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  She is from one of the villages that makes up Sanda. Her husband is a businessman. Ramatu sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), which she has been doing for many years.

Ramatu and her group members are requesting their first loan from SMT. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and improve their living conditions. Ramatu will use her share of the loan (700,000 SLL) to buy palm oil at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia is 35 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a plumber. Both of them have three children between 4 and 13 years old who are currently in school and live at home.

For the past eight years, Felecia has been selling rice, oil, cool water, etc. in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers. 

Felecia is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, cool water, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, cool water, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Five Traders Group

texts.en:
Mamusu and her teammates are very grateful to you for the loan. With the help of your previous loan, each of these borrowers was able to increase on her business inventories. This increases their sales and profit-to-sales-margin. 

These borrowers use the profit they make to feed their children, pay their school fees, and so on. However, their businesses still require further improvement; hence they have again reapplied for a loan of SLL 700,000 for each. This new loan will help them to further improve on the quality and quantity of their respective businesses. 

Mamusu is again going to use her share of this loan to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fresh fish.

loans.name: Tagbaneh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva's in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Tagbaneh” group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva's lenders to request a loan of 1,500,000.00 SLL each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Fatu is the leader of this group. She is a 64-year-old widow with six children, two of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Fatu sells market food – margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), pepper, cooking oil, etc. – and has been doing this for many years now. With the help of this loan, Fatu will buy margi, pepper, cooking oil, etc. in large quantities for her business.

loans.use: to buy margi, pepper, cooking oil, etc. in large quantities for her business.

loans.name: Active Group

texts.en:
Greetings are coming to you from the members of the Active group. These women are very pleased to inform you that their previous Kiva loan has been very helpful in the growth and development of their respective businesses. Having finished repayment of that loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan of SLL 1,500,000 for each (SLL 3,000,000 total), in order to further expand the sizes and qualities of their respective businesses.

The featured member and leader, Kadiatu, is again going to use her share of the loan to buy palm oil in large quantity to add to her business inventory. She will also use part of the loan to buy firewood for resale.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of palm oil for her food market, and to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Paynesville South, which is one of the more populated areas in Montserrado County. She is 50 years old. She is a widow with 8 children between the ages of 22 to 34, and they all live on their own. For the past 20 years she has been selling pepper, oil, vita, etc. She started this business with a small amount that she received from her friend, and she learned this way of business from her friends. She uses the profits from her business to maintain her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, oil, vita, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more pepper, oil, vita, etc. for her business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 66 años de edad, es padre de cinco hijos en las edades de 36, 34, 28, 26, y 22 años, todos independientes, es jubilado, actualmente se dedica junto a su esposa a la venta de refrescos naturales y repostería, esto dentro de su hogar, solicita el crédito con el objetivo de continuar mejoras en su casa, específicamente el frente de la casa y el techo de esta, ya que desde que logro adquirir la propiedad ha querido realizar las mejoras y hasta la fecha se le había dificultado por la falta de ingresos necesarios para llevarlas a cabo, poco a poco ha podido mejorar su vivienda con préstamos adquiridos en esta institución y reformar así el área de la cocina y los cuartos de la misma, ya q cuenta con el completo apoyo de sus hijos. Al recibir el crédito Carlos planea comprar bloques, cemento, hierro, entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Carlos, 66, is father of five children aged 36, 34, 28, 26 and 22 years; all are independent.  He’s retired and he and his wife currently work selling natural refreshments and pastry at home.  He’s asking for the loan to continue with home improvements, specifically the front of the house and the roof since he’s wanted to make these improvements to the house since he acquired the property and to date has had difficulty doing so for lack of the necessary income.  He’s gradually been able to do some home improvements thanks to loans from this institution and was able to remodel the kitchen and the bedrooms since he has support from his children.  When Carlos gets the loan he plans to use it to buy blocks, cement and iron rods, among other building supplies.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en:
Korpo is 27 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and has two children, ages eight months and eight years. Only one of them is currently in school, and they both live at home. 

For three years, Korpo has been selling food items, like okra, bitter ball, palm oil, salt, onions, and vita, in the local market. She started this business with a little amount of capital she received from her husband. She enjoys the buying by her customers and the money that she generates from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more items like those listed, to expand her business. Her plans are to build a house, and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to enlarge her inventory, like okra, palm oil and onions.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Madame Astou est une femme mariée. Elle est âgée de 55 ans et mère de deux enfants .
Elle s'active dans le petit commerce par la vente de patte d’arachide et de tissus teintés.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 350000 francs cfa elle va se payer 30000 francs de patte d’arachide et 30 coupons de tissus teintés a 7000 francs l'un qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de son quartier.
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.

Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de renforcer son fond de commerce et de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Astou is a married woman. She is 55 years old and the mother of two children. She is active in small-scale commerce selling peanut butter and dyed fabrics. With her new loan of 350,000 francs CFA, she is going to spend 30,000 francs for peanut butter and 7,000 francs for 30 lengths of dyed fabrics to sell retail in her district. 

She has good experience in this domain for having done it for a long time. The profits earned enable her to bolster her business capital and to meet the food needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase peanut butter and some cloth to sell retail

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
Greetings are coming to you from members of the Tamaraneh group. They are very pleased to inform you that their previous Kiva loan has made a huge impact in their businesses and personal lives. With the help of that loan, they were able to add to their business inventories. This led to an increase in sales and profit. They used the profit they made to repay the loan, feed their children and send them to school.

Having repaid the previous loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan now, of SLL 700,000 for each member, in order to further improve on the quality and quantity of the respective businesses.

The featured leader, Aminata, is going to use her share of the loan to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock of fish. Though Aminata faces a number of challenges in her business, such as times of poor sales, and fish do spoil within a very short period, she has made very many successes, as well. She is able to provide food for her children and support them in their educational pursuit. Aminata dreams of expanding her business, and thanks to Kiva loans, she is on the verge of achieving her dream.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock of fish

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Paula is the coordinator of this group called Amor y Amistad 3 & 4 ("Love and Friendship"). The area in which the borrowers live is a nascent tourist zone, surrounded by the Atlantic Ocean and mountains, rivers and natural breezes. 

Paula is a married mother who lives in the beautiful town of Samana with her three children. She says her most important challenge is to keep her business stable and sustainable. She enjoys working and serving the needs of her family and friends.

Paula is receiving her twelfth loan with Esperanza Internacional, having repaid all her previous loans. After seven years of investment, her business has been growing to the point where she is selling a greater range of products and acquiring more clients and communities. 

Paula will use this loan to purchase clothing such as pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, and shoes for both women and men. She will reinvest her profits in her business and is also planning to add other high-demand products for school supplies. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothing such as pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, and shoes for both women and men.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacimiento 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Inocencia is the coordinator of the group, Nuevo Renacimiento (New Renaissance) 1, 2 & 3, located in the city of Samana. Samana is in one of the rural areas surrounded by the water of the Atlantic ocean. Many of the group members are selling goods, like bread, clothing, shoes or cosmetics. Others sell seafood, or run fried food stalls or other businesses. 

Inocencia lives together with her long-term partner. She is running a fried food stall, specializing in fried pork chops and skin. She started her business around two years ago. She wants to invest her share of this loan to buy different pigs, to expand her pork inventory and thereby increase her sales. This is her first loan. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business, but she has made it possible to sell her foods to her community and others nearby. 

She will use this loan to complete her capital, by buying two or three pigs. She is hoping to make her dreams come true: to have a prosperous life and a good business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy pigs, to expand her pork inventory and thereby increase her sales of fried pork chops and skin.

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Martires is the coordinator of his group, Amor y Amistad 1 & 2 (Love and Peace). He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long-term partner and their two children. Martires is excited to be taking his sixteenth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loan and having developed his business by expanding his client base and by buying more products. 

Martires has had his business for almost ten years, starting with the first loan he received from Esperanza, after some neighbors invited him to join the group. 

He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by purchasing pounds of fish and chicken to sell fried with sweet potatoes and fried plantain, as well as coconuts in order to sell their water. He will continue using his business profits to provide a better life for his family by finishing building their house and by providing warm food, clothing, and for other needs.

Martires’ group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a burgeoning tourism industry, where most of the group members sell their products in their communities and surrounding areas.

loans.use: to buy chicken, fish, coconut, sweet potatoes, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth to resell

loans.name: Jayjay

texts.en:
Jayjay is 34 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is single and has two children, who are  9 months and 18 years old. Only one of them is presently in school, and both live at home.

For the past 20 years Jayjay has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. She makes more profit, and she has too few goods in stock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried bush meat, dried fish, pigs' feet, pepper, bitter ball, onions and rice, for her business inventory. She plans to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more dried bush meat, dried fish, pigs' feet, pepper, bitter ball, onions and rice, for her business,

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr: Anne Marie est une mère de famille agée de 44 ans qui a ouvert dans un quartier de la place,une alimentation.Son activité consiste à commercialiser des produits divers à l'instar des cartons de riz, de biscuits,sacs de spaguettis, bouteilles d'huiles.Pour subvenir à ses besoins,elle exerce comme activité secondaire,la vente de credit de communication,communément appellé CALL BOX.Pour ce qui est de son alimentation,elle sollicite un credit qui lui permettra d'augmenter sa clientèle,d'éviter les éventuels ruptures de stock et de rechercher quelqueqs marges bénéficiaires.Les benefices générés par ce credit l'aideront à faire grandir davantage son activité et par ailleurs à investir dans les études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Anne Marie is a mother with a family. She is 44 years old and has opened a grocery store in a local district. Her business involves selling a variety of goods, such as boxes of rice, cookies, bags of spaghetti, and bottles of oil. To support herself, she has a secondary business selling communication credits (phone minutes) commonly called CALL BOX. 

For her grocery store, she is requesting a loan enabling her to increase her customer base, avoid possible inventory shortages, have some profit margin. The profits generated by this loan will help her to enlarge her business further and also to invest in her children's schooling.

loans.use: to increase her inventory (rice, cookies, oil...)

loans.name: Zoodnooma De Zongo Group

texts.fr:
Mme  PINGDWENDESAFIATOU représente le groupe ZOODNOOMA DE ZONGO. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06 ans et le moins âgés à 04 ans. 01 va  à l’école et elle a 02 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend des habits et pommades depuis 02ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont les  hommes, femmes et les nouvelles mamans.
Elle veut s’acheter  06  pièces de pagnes, 04 douzaines d’habits pour enfants et 30 boites de différentes pommades.	
Elle veut  épargner  ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne  améliorer son activité, aider ses frères pour leur scolarisation et aider son père à construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. PINGDWENDESAFIATOU represents the group ZOODNOOMA DE ZONGO. She is in good health. She is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 6 years old, and the youngest is 4. One of them goes to school. She has two persons to support. 

She has been selling clothing and ointments for two years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market. Her customers including men, women, and new mothers. 

She wants to purchase 6 lengths of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), 4 dozen of children's clothing, and 30 containers of different ointments. She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to improve her business, help her brothers with their schooling costs, and help her father to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth, children's clothing, and different ointments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and cover the cost of labor.

loans.name: Amapolas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAPOLAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, tunta y chuño, producción de café, venta y costura de polleras, tejido y venta de chompas, inicio de negocio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilaria es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta papa,, chuño y tunta (ambas anteriores son papa deshidratada) y tejido de chompas; cuenta que estos negocios los aprendió cuando vendía con su abuela, hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa, chuño y tunta) que adquirirá de los mercados de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amapolas" [Poppies] will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Tejada regional hub.  It is comprised of six members and is managed by a board of directors, of which Hilaria is the president.

The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied and include:  selling potatoes, chuño [artisanal freeze-dried potato], and freeze-dried potatoes; coffee production; sewing and sale of skirts; knitting and sale of sweaters; start-up businesses.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-businesswomen, of whom Hilaria is one.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago, at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling potatoes, chuño, and freeze-dried potatoes (the former two are dehydrated potatoes) and knitting sweaters.  She recounts that she learned these businesses when she used to sell with her grandmother, many years ago.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase capital (purchase of potato, chuño, and freeze-dried potatoes) that she will acquire wholesale from the markets in the city of El Alto, and later sell in her stall.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as much as possible, as she is married and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training in the area of health and credit.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chuño [artisanal freeze-dried potato], and freeze-dried potatoes.

loans.name: Irimbere Group

texts.fr:
Claver fait partie du groupe Irimbere  et   habite à Gitega. Il  a   34 ans et est marié à Joséphine, une vendeuse d’habits. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, âgés de 2  à 6ans, dont 1  étudient.
Il a sous sa charge un orphelin.

Il fait le commerce des habits   depuis  2  ans. 

Il est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits    à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait augmenter le capital pour acheter  des habits de plusieurs types. Il voudrait en outre voir ses enfants mener une bonne vie et continuer les études.
texts.en:
Claver is part of the group Irimbere. He lives in Gitega, and he is 34 years old and married to Joséphine, a clothing retailer. Together they have three children, from 2 to 6 years old; one of them is a student. Claver has an orphan in his care.

Claver has been doing commerce in clothing for two years. 

He is on his eighth loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a lot of clothing to resell, in order to earn more

In the coming years, he would like to increase his capital to purchase several types of clothing. Furthermore, he would like to see his children lead a good life and continue in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase many clothes to resell in order to earn more

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth and handbags to resell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 49 años vive en compañía de Paulino, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todo menores a los que cuidan en la casa que compraron hace 15 años.  Todos los días junto a su esposo, salen a cuidar sus sembríos de maíz y papa en sus terrenos propios, los que cuida con mucho esmero, como le gusta mucho la agricultura y miró la manera de poder utilizar las sobras de fertilizantes y semillas, construyó en su casa un vivero, donde siembra diversas hortalizas y vegetales, esto le sirve a ella para su propio consumo, “así no gasto mucho en los alimentos de mis hijos, además son de calidad pues son orgánicos”, comenta. En época de cosecha, comercializa sus productos en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde ella misma lleva a vender sus alimentos, ya que es conocedora del lugar y los negociantes. Ahora posee 2 vacas que piensa alimentar y engordar para poder extraer leche y así realizar queso, espera concretar su nuevo proyecto, pues quiere comercializarlos en la ciudad, aprovechando los viajes que realiza para comercializar sus propias cosechas. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta trabajar en su asociación, donde todos son personas responsables y solidarias. Juana, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Juana is forty-nine years old and lives in the company of Paulino, her husband.  Together, they have four children.  All the children are still minors and so Juana and her husband care for them in the house they bought fifteen years ago.  

Every day, Juana and her husband go out to care for the corn and potato crops on their own lands, which they tend with great care.  She likes agriculture a lot.  She saw a way of using the leftover fertilizers and seeds, and built a nursery in her home where she plants diverse herbs and vegetables.  This serves Juana for her own use: "In this, I don't spend a lot on food for my children; furthermore, [the herbs and vegetables] are of a good quality, since they are organic," she says.  

In the harvest season, she sells her products in the city of Huancayo, where she also brings her nursery foods to sell; she is already an expert of the city and of the businesspeople there.  She currently has two cows that she thinks of feeding and fattening in order to be able to milk them and thereby make cheese.  She hopes to solidify her new project, and to also sell these products in the city, taking advantage of the trips she already makes to trade the products from her own harvests.  

This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She gives thanks for the opportunity offered to her, since she already will be able to improve her business.  In this, she promises to be punctual with the payments of her installments.  She likes to work within this organization, where all the people are responsible and supportive.

Juana will invest the loan money in the purchase of organic fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase seeds and chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Irafasha Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Irafasha est composé de  8 femmes et un homme .Le jour de l’octroi du crédit, Sabine,  Joséphine et Espérance  trois   membres du  groupe, de sexe féminin  étaient malades. Sur la photo, elles ont été  représentées par leurs maris respectifs : Pascal, Bonaventure, et Jacques.
Anicet,  le représentant du groupe  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a  40  ans et est marié  à Jovanie. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants, âgés de  5   à 15 ans, dont  4 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge un membre de sa famille élargie, qui étudie.

Il  fait le commerce des produits de la forge (sceaux, malles métalliques,…) depuis  12 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  tôles pour la fabrication de sceaux, de malles,…en grande quantité,   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il  voudrait faire le commerce de boutique(haricot, lait de beauté, chaussures,...). Il voudrait en outre, voir ses enfants étudier et terminer les études.
texts.en:
The group Irafasha comprises eight women and one man. On the day the loan was granted, Sabine, Joséphine, and Espérance, three female members of the group, were sick. In the photo, they are represented by their respective husbands: Pascal, Bonaventure, and Jacques.

Anicet, the group's representative, lives in Bujumbura. He is 40 years old and married to Jovanie. Together they have six children, from 5 to 15 years old, of whom four are in school. He has a member of his extended family in his care who is a student. 

He has been doing commerce in hardware (buckets, metal trunks, …) for twelve years. 

He is on his fourth loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a lot of sheetmetal to make buckets, trunks, … in large quantities to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to do commerce in shop goods (beans, beauty lotions, shoes,…) Furthermore, he would like to see his children study and complete their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of sheetmetal for making buckets, trunks,... in large amounts in order to sell and earn more

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth and handbags to sell

loans.name: María Gilma

texts.es:
Achuapa un bello y encantador municipio donde se dedica a diferentes actividades comerciales, es aquí donde habita la joven María Gilma.

María Gilma es una madre soltera, cuenta con dos hijos bajo su cargo, ambos estudian, uno en la universidad y el otro en la primaria, a duras penas ella mantiene la alimentación de estos pequeños y los gastos universitario de su hija, pero también ve de gran necesidad de sus hijos poderle comprar una computadora para mejorar la enseñanza que tanto necesitan. 
Cuenta con una buena salud, su honestidad y su buen record crediticio que le ha ido logrando el desarrollo de sus hijos.  

Agradece a Dios por haberle iluminado de poder Solicitar un Crédito con Ceprodel y Kiva y espera que le brinden el financiamiento para poder llegar a obtener parte de sus principales sueños de lograr a darles una mejor enseñanza a sus queridos y amados hijos.
texts.en:
Achuapa, a beautiful and enchanting town, dedicated to various commercial activities – it is here where the young Maria Gilma lives.  

Maria Gilma is a single mother, who has two children under her care.   Both study, one in the university and the other in primary school.  She can barely afford to provide food for the children and pay the university costs for her daughter, but she also sees a big need of her children is for her to buy them a computer to improve their education, which they greatly need.  It is because of good health, her honesty and her good credit record that she has been able to succeed in developing her children.  

She gives thanks to God for having enlightened her to be able to request a loan with Ceprodel and Kiva and she hopes that they provide her the financing to be able to obtain part of her main dreams of succeeding in giving a better education to her beloved children.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana, de 48 años se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Antonio, su esposo desde hace 31 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero viven con 2 de ellos: Katy y Rosa en la casa que heredaron de sus padres hace 20 años. 
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con su asociación de la que fue invitada para progresar como los demás integrantes, se siente muy bien pues está convencida de poder triunfar con la ayuda de todos. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en la siembra de papa, maíz y todo tipo de hortalizas, en terrenos agrícolas propios y alquilados. Aprovecha las largas jornadas en el campo para cuidar de sus animales como: vacas, toros, cerdos, “quien  sabe trabajar, dedica todo el día al cuidado de sus sembríos pues es importante tener de buena calidad”, comenta. Al mismo tiempo menciona que aprovecha los toros que posee, para hacer arado con la ayuda de su esposo. Asimismo cuenta que, el fin de semana aprovecha para vender comida, tiene muchos años cocinando y los comensales que visitan su puesto, consumen con frecuencia, de esa manera obtiene un dinero extra.
Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Huaribamba” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con el mejoramiento de sus sembríos, razón por la que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas.
Juliana, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Juliana, 48, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with Antonio, her husband for 31 years.  Together they have five children, two of whom, Katy y Rosa, live with them in the house they inherited from her parents 20 years ago.

This is the second time she has worked with her association, which she was invited to join so she could make progress like the other members.  She feels very good because she's convinced she'll be able to triumph with everyone's help.

Her main income is growing potatoes, corn, and all types of vegetables on her own farmland and on rented land.  She makes the most of the long days in the field to care for her animals, such as cows, bulls, and pigs.  

"Someone who knows how to work spends the entire day caring for her plants," she says, "because it's important to have good quality.  At the same time she mentions that she makes the most of her bulls to do the plowing with her husband's help.  She also says she takes advantage of the weekend to sell food.  She has been cooking for many years and the diners who visit her stall eat there frequently.  This ways she gets some extra money.

She belongs to the Huaribamba solidarity group and this is her second loan with MFP, where she feels fulfilled and happy.  She hopes to get the loan to continue improving her fields, which is why she promises to make her payments punctually.

Juliana will invest the money in buying organic fertilizer to spread on her sown fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: Yadira del Carmen tiene treinta y ocho años de edad, dos hijos de 16 y 11 años, es soltera y desde hace seis años instalo una pequeña pulpería en su hogar con mucho esfuerzo, con el objetivo de solventar los gastos de su hogar, solicita el crédito con el fin de poder surtir su pulpería en la compra de arroz, azucar, frijoles, sal, jabon, aceite, cafe, detergentes entre otros y así conservar a su clientela, quienes se mantienen fiel debido a la buena atención que ella les brinda, sus metas son mejorar su negocio y la estructura física de sus casa, pero principalmente que sus hijos terminen sus estudios sin ningún problema, Yadira agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua..
texts.en:
Yadira del Carmen, 38, is single and has two children, ages 16 and 11.  Six years ago she set up a small store in her home with a lot of effort so she could pay for her household expenses.

She's requesting the loan to be able to stock her store by buying rice, sugar, beans, salt, soap, oil, coffee, detergent, and other things.  This way she'll be able to keep her customers, who are loyal because of her good service.

Her goals are to improve her business and the physical structure of her house, but mainly for her children to finish their studies without any problems.

Yadira's grateful for the help that Kiva lenders offer to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Milagro Elizabeth

texts.es:
Milagro, tiene 26 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y vende tortillas y ropa de forma ambulante para poder obtener ingresos y ayudar a su familia. Ella tiene tres años de tener el negocio, aprendió por iniciativa propia, lo realiza de lunes a sábado por las mañanas la venta de tortillas y  por la tarde vende ropa de forma ambulante.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, que son los necesarios para realizar las tortillas, tendrá el dinero necesario para realizar la compra de los productos y así podrá continuar realizando sus ventas.
La aspiración de Milagro es darle una vida mejor a sus hijos, que puedan estudiar y prepararse para el futuro.
texts.en:
Milagro is 26 years old and has two children, ages 7 and 3.  She is a single mother and lives with her parents.  She sells tortillas and clothing on foot so that she can earn an income to help her family.  She has had this business for three years and learned it on her own initiative.  She sells tortillas on Monday through Saturday mornings and clothing on foot in the evenings.

She is asking for this loan to buy corn and firewood, which she needs to make tortillas.  This will give her the money she needs to buy the supplies and she will be able to make her sales.

Milagro’s aspiration is to provide a better life for her children who attend school to prepare for their future.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvín, solicita un préstamo para poder continuar en el negocio de lácteos, en esta ocasión comprara un frízer para mantener mejor el inventario de los productos, ya que estará teniéndolos frescos con mayor duración.

Con el préstamo anterior le ayudo a que el negocio mejorara, logrando tener buenas ventas y que sus clientes estuvieran satisfechos con los productos que provee, en su familia considera que los ingresos que ha recibido por las ventas han subsanado sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Marvin is asking for a loan so that he can continue in his milk product business.  He will use the money to buy a freezer to keep an inventory of his products, since he will be able to keep them fresh longer.

He used the money from the previous loan to improve his business and he had good sales and his customers were satisfied with his products.  The income he received allowed him to provide the basic needs for his family.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es:
Rudy, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque considera que trabajar a través de ellos le ha permitido tener mayores beneficios en los cultivos, pues compra lo necesario para que su desarrollo sea adecuado y la producción, hoy se encuentra iniciando un nuevo cultivo para el que comprara abono y otros insumos necesarios.
Él considera que el efecto que le dio el crédito anterior fue positivo, ayudándole a mejorar sus ganancias con la producción de la siembra, esto le ha generado una mejor estabilidad, piensa seguir trabajando y contar con este apoyo de Padecomsm y Kiva, su deseo es a futuro comprar un terreno donde realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rudy has requested a new loan because he feels that working with them has allowed him to have better benefits with his crops and now he can buy the necessary supplies to have good production.  At the moment he is starting a new crop and he will buy compost and other supplies.

He feels that the previous loan was positive and it helped him improve his earnings with his production.  This provided better stability and he plans to keep working and count on the support of Padecomsm and Kiva.  His desire for the future is to buy land that he can work.

loans.use: to buy compost.
